title: Video Editor
description:
???? Video Editor (Reels + YouTube)



Contract | Remote | Growth Opportunity



We are seeking a highly skilled, brand-savvy Video Editor to support our fast-growing media and personal brand ecosystem.



This is not a basic editing role.



We are building premium, authority-driven brands — and we need someone who understands storytelling, rhythm, audience psychology, and visual alignment.



You will be responsible for transforming raw footage into captivating, high-performing content across:



Instagram Reels



TikTok



YouTube Shorts



Long-form YouTube episodes



Client promotional content



This role supports both our internal brands and select high-caliber clients — meaning attention to detail and brand integrity is non-negotiable.



???? What You’ll Do



Edit short-form video content optimized for engagement, retention, and conversion



Repurpose long-form podcast or speaking footage into multiple short clips



Edit full-length YouTube episodes with clean pacing, graphics, and sound optimization



Add captions, motion graphics, callouts, and brand-consistent overlays



Maintain visual consistency across multiple brands



Collaborate with leadership to ensure tone, pacing, and positioning align with authority-driven messaging



Implement feedback quickly and accurately



Organize and manage video files within shared systems



???? What We’re Looking For



3+ years of video editing experience (social + YouTube required)



Strong understanding of storytelling structure and hook strategy



Experience editing for personal brands, thought leaders, coaches, or media brands preferred



High-level attention to detail (audio leveling, jump cuts, pacing, transitions)



Ability to match brand tone and visual standards consistently



Comfortable working with multiple brand guides



Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or equivalent professional editing software



Familiarity with motion graphics (After Effects or similar is a plus)



Ability to turn content around efficiently without sacrificing quality



???? What Sets You Apart



You understand retention metrics and how to optimize for watch time



You study trends — but you don’t chase them blindly



You care about brand elevation, not just output volume



You anticipate what will convert — not just what looks good



You think like a creative partner, not just an executor



???? Details



Contract-based role (with potential for long-term partnership)



Flexible hours, deadline-driven



Opportunity to grow alongside a rapidly expanding podcast network and brand portfolio



Competitive compensation based on experience



???? To Apply



Please submit:



Your portfolio (short-form + YouTube examples required)



A brief description of your editing process



A short note on how you ensure brand alignment across multiple clients



Your rate (hourly or per project)



We are looking for someone who is hungry, meticulous, creative, and committed to excellence.



If you love helping bold brands be seen, heard, and remembered — we’d love to meet you.



Please send examples of your work and also look up our brand - 
 | 
/allisonwalsh

title: Brand & Marketing Manager (Part-Time, Hybrid)
description:
Brand & Marketing Manager (Part-Time, Hybrid)



Build a brand people feel. Drive growth you can measure.



You’re tired of “marketing activity” that looks good but doesn’t move the needle. At Shym Saunas, brand is a growth lever — and we’re looking for a Brand & Marketing Manager who knows how to pull it.



About Shym Saunas



Shym Saunas is a premium sauna brand built for people who value wellbeing, design, and meaningful time together — without compromise. We’re founder-led, fast-moving, and intentionally building something distinctive in the wellness space.



We care deeply about craft, clarity, and outcomes. We don’t do fluff. We do work that earns attention and converts trust into revenue. We’ve built strong product-market fit and demand — now we’re ready to professionalise brand and turn marketing into a scalable growth engine.



About the Role



Reporting directly to the Founder, this part-time (2 days/week), hybrid role owns the brand and marketing function end-to-end.



You are accountable for:



Clear brand positioning and messaging



Consistency across every customer touchpoint



Marketing execution that drives measurable commercial outcomes



This is a senior, hands-on role. You’ll think strategically, then get it done — working closely with founders and managing external partners to ensure marketing efforts translate into growth.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Brand Leadership & Accountability



Own and protect brand positioning, tone of voice, and visual identity



Act as the brand gatekeeper for all brand-facing assets



Translate founder vision into clear brand strategy and execution guidelines



Marketing Strategy & Execution



Build and deliver a rolling 90-day marketing plan aligned to revenue priorities



Own campaigns across website & eCommerce, social (organic & paid oversight),
, and partnerships



Brief, manage, and hold agencies and partners accountable to commercial outcomes — not just outputs



Content & Creative Direction



Set the content strategy and publishing cadence



Approve all copy, imagery, and video to ensure premium quality



Balance brand storytelling, education, and conversion



Performance & Optimisation



Define and track KPIs across brand, marketing, and revenue contribution



Review performance weekly and monthly; adjust based on data



Provide clear summaries to founders: what worked, what didn’t, and what changes next



Partnerships, PR & Growth



Identify and activate strategic partnerships with commercial intent



Oversee influencer and ambassador initiatives tied to revenue



Support PR and earned media with defined objectives



What Success Looks Like (First 6–12 Months)



Sharpened brand positioning and messaging across all channels



A consistent, premium brand experience at every customer touchpoint



A marketing system that reliably contributes to pipeline and revenue



What You’ll Bring



Advanced experience in brand strategy and positioning



Strong commercial acumen — you care about ROI, not vanity metrics



Confidence leading agencies and external partners



A sharp eye for content, storytelling, and quality control



The ability to operate autonomously in a scaling, founder-led business



Calm, structured problem-solving and ruthless prioritisation



Bonus: experience in premium consumer brands, lifestyle, wellness, or design-led products



Why Join Shym Saunas



Direct access to the Founder and real decision-making authority



The chance to shape a premium brand at a critical growth stage



Flexibility: part-time, hybrid, senior impact without full-time burnout



A business that values clarity, quality, and outcomes over noise



Ready to Build Something That Matters?



If you want ownership, influence, and the opportunity to turn brand into a true growth engine, we’d love to hear from you.



How to apply:

 your CV and a 2-minute video introduction (tell us why this role fits you and how you’d create impact in your first 90 days) to:

title: SEO Specialist
description:
Role Overview

This role owns local SEO execution, reporting, and select client communication for our home-service focused agency in a self-managed role.



The SEO Specialist is responsible for creating and optimizing content, managing on-page and local SEO, handling basic website updates, delivering clear performance reporting, and communicating directly with clients on content approvals and updates. This role requires strong independent execution, accountability, and clear communication.



Core Responsibilities

SEO & Content Execution

- Independently plan, create, optimize, and publish SEO-driven content including blogs, service pages, and location pages



- Execute on-page SEO improvements across title tags, meta descriptions, headings, internal linking, content enhancements, technical fixes



- Optimize existing pages to improve rankings, traffic, and conversions by identifying and implementing SEO opportunities without step-by-step guidance



- Own Google Business Profile (GBP) management, including ongoing optimization using SEO best practices



- Monitor GBP performance and apply optimizations to improve visibility and engagement



Website Support

- Complete basic website updates and fixes such as content edits, formatting issues, and minor glitches in Webflow (primary) and WordPress (as needed)



- Troubleshoot common website issues independently and communicate resolutions or updates as needed



Reporting & Admin Support

- Own weekly Google Ads reporting and monthly KPI reporting across SEMRush, Search Console, Google Analytics, Google Ads, Local Services Ads (LSA), Google Analytics, and GBP insights



- Support light administrative tasks related to reporting and client management via
, Asana, and Google Drive



Required Skills & Experience

- Proven experience owning SEO and local SEO execution independently



- Strong SEO content creation and on-page optimization experience



- Hands-on experience with SEMRush or Ahrefs, Local Dominator or Local Falcon, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Ads, LSA, and GBP insights



- Experience working in Webflow and WordPress



- Strong problem-solving and communication skills with a self-starter mindset



How This Role Will Be Measured

- SEO content and optimizations are delivered consistently and on schedule



- Local SEO and Google Business Profiles are actively managed and optimized



- Weekly Google Ads and monthly KPI reports are accurate, clear, and on time



- Communication is professional, timely, and effective



- Issues are raised with proposed solutions



- Multiple clients and deadlines are managed independently without missed deliverables



For attention to detail, please include the word ‘cat’ in the subject line of your response.

title: Media Buyer – Google Ads & Meta (Lead Gen | US Dental Agency | Full-Time Remote)
description:

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing

/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: JOB POST: Hybrid Admin VA & Appointment Setter
description:
Position: Virtual Assistant / Appointment Setter (Part-Time)

Company: LeadForge

Location: Remote

Compensation: [$
/month]



About Us



LeadForge is a lead generation agency serving high-ticket home renovation contractors in Canada. We help our clients fill their calendar with qualified homeowners ready to invest in premium renovations. We're growing fast and need a sharp, reliable tea
mber who can wear two hats: keeping our operations running smoothly AND being the first voice a lead hears when they come in.



The Role



You'll be responsible for two core functions:



1. Speed-to-Lead Appointment Setting: When a lead comes in, you're on it within minutes. You call, you qualify, you book. No delays. No excuses. Our clients' revenue depends on how fast and effectively you connect with leads.



2. Admin & Booking Validation: You'll manage the back-end of our booking system, ensuring appointments are properly passed to client platforms, confirmed, and organized. You'll handle rescheduling, cancellations, and keep everything tight so nothing falls through the cracks.



What You'll Do Daily



APPOINTMENT SETTING (roughly 60% of your time):

~ Call, text, and follow up with inbound leads within 1 to 5 minutes of them coming in

~ Qualify leads using our proven script (we train you on this)

~ Book qualified appointments directly onto our clients' calendars

~ Follow a structured cadence for leads who don't answer on the first attempt

~ Hit daily dial targets and booking KPIs



ADMIN & BOOKING VALIDATION (roughly 40% of your time):

~ Transfer/pass appointments between our booking platform and client CRMs where needed

~ Confirm all upcoming appointments via call and text to maximize show rates

~ Handle reschedules and cancellations professionally

~ Update lead statuses and notes in GHL

~ Flag any lead quality issues or client concerns to management immediately

~ Assist with basic onboarding tasks for new clients as needed



You're a Fit If You...



~ Have excellent spoken English (this is non-negotiable, you're calling Canadian homeowners)

~ Have experience in outbound/inbound calling, appointment setting, or customer service

~ Are comfortable using CRM tools like GoHighLevel, Calendly, or similar

~ Can work North American business hours (Mountain Standard Time preferred given our Alberta market)

~ Are organized and detail-oriented, nothing slips through the cracks with you

~ Are hungry and coachable, you want to grow into a bigger role as we scale

~ Have a quiet workspace, reliable internet, and a quality headset



Bonus Points For



~ Previous experience in a lead gen agency or call center environment

~ Familiarity with GoHighLevel specifically

~ Experience working with home services or contractor leads

~ Knowledge about
 Ads



What We Offer



~ $
USD per month

~ Paid training on our systems, scripts, and processes

~ Clear growth path (as we scale, this role evolves into a dedicated setter or team lead position)

~ A small, fast-moving team where your work directly impacts results

~ Performance bonuses tied to booking and show rate KPIs

title: GL Accountant (For Pooling)
description:
We are building a talent pool of experienced GL Accountants for potential client requirements, supporting entities in the United States, Australia, and Singapore.



This role is for pooling purposes only. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted as soon as matching client opportunities become available.



Job Overview

The GL Accountant will be responsible for managing general ledger activities, ensuring accurate financial reporting, and maintaining compliance with applicable accounting standards (US GAAP, with possible AU / SG exposure).



Key Responsibilities

Oversee and manage the general ledger process, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and compliance with US GAAP

Lead monthly, quarterly, and annual close processes for assigned entities

Perform bank and balance sheet reconciliations, including provision accounts

Investigate and resolve discrepancies and variances

Prepare and review journal entries, including accruals, deferrals, depreciation, amortization, straight-line rent, amortization, and reclassifications

Ensure proper accounting treatment of fixed assets (capitalization, depreciation, impairment, and retirement)

Perform variance analysis and provide explanations for financial results

Manage multi-currency transactions, including foreign exchange gains and losses

Act as Point of Contact (POC) for assigned entities or subsidiaries

Communicate directly with AP, AR, auditors, and internal stakeholders

Support audit activities by preparing schedules and responding to auditor inquiries

Identify opportunities to improve and automate accounting processes

Support transition from 15-day close to 10-day close

Assist in documenting onboarding and accounting processes



Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance

Strong understanding of US GAAP (required)

Minimum 3 years of relevant accounting experience

Experience with NetSuite or another large ERP system (required)

Advanced MS Excel skills

Hands-on experience with month-end close and reconciliations

Ability to multi-task, prioritize deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Team-oriented, professional, and positive attitude



Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting US, AU, or Singapore entities

Multi-entity and multi-currency accounting exposure

Audit support experience

CPA or equivalent certification



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

- Your application letter

- Unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

GLAcctPooling – YOUR FULL NAME



Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

title: Payroll Accounting Specialist
description:
Shift: Night Shift (PST)

Job Type: Full-time / Independent Contractor / Remote



Please Note

Applicants without solid U.S. payroll processing and payroll accounting experience will not be considered.

Strong payroll systems proficiency (Rippling preferred), advanced Excel skills, and hands-on experience with payroll reconciliations, audits, and compliance are required.



About the Role

We are seeking a highly capable Payroll Accounting Specialist to support accurate, timely, and compliant payroll operations for a global workforce. This role sits within the Finance team and partners closely with People, Accounting, and external vendors.



You will own end-to-end payroll processing, payroll accounting, reconciliations, audits, and reporting, while supporting select employee lifecycle activities through close collaboration with the People team.



This role is ideal for someone with a strong payroll and accounting mindset, excellent attention to detail, advanced Excel skills, and the ability to operate confidently in a fast-paced, evolving environment.



What You’ll Do

*Payroll Processing & Administration

Own end-to-end payroll processing for U.S. employees

Ensure payroll accuracy across earnings, deductions, taxes, benefits, equity, commissions, and one-time payments

Coordinate payroll calendars, cutoffs, off-cycle runs, and year-end payroll activities

Partner with payroll vendors and internal teams to resolve payroll issues and employee inquiries



*Payroll Accounting & Reconciliations

Prepare and review payroll journal entries in accordance with U.S. GAAP

Perform payroll balance sheet and expense reconciliations each pay period and month-end

Support payroll accruals, true-ups, and payroll-related estimates

Maintain payroll documentation to support audits and internal controls



*Compliance & Reporting

Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll tax requirements

Support payroll audits, benefits audits, and external financial audits

Assist with W-2, 1099, and other year-end payroll filings

Maintain accurate payroll records and supporting schedules



*Systems & Data Management

Administer payroll and HRIS systems, with a focus on data integrity and controls

Partner on system testing, implementations, and payroll process improvements

Maintain accurate employee data related to payroll, compensation, and benefits



*Cross-Functional People Support

Partner with the People team on onboarding, offboarding, and employee changes impacting payroll

Support benefits and leave programs as they relate to payroll processing and deductions

Assist with headcount reporting, budgeting support, and workforce analytics



*Ad Hoc Analysis & Projects

Build payroll reports and models using advanced Excel

Support special projects related to payroll transformation, system upgrades, and process standardization



Who You Are

A clear and professional communicator

Service-oriented and responsive to employee needs

Highly detail-oriented with strong follow-through

Organized and comfortable managing recurring payroll deadlines

Proactive and effective working across Finance and People teams

Adaptable and confident in evolving environments



Required Education, Experience, and Skills

3–5+ years of experience in payroll processing and payroll accounting

Strong understanding of U.S. payroll, taxes, and wage compliance

Hands-on experience preparing payroll journal entries and reconciliations

Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, complex formulas)

Experience working with payroll systems and HRIS platforms (Rippling preferred)

Experience supporting audits and maintaining payroll controls

Ability to analyze payroll data and clearly explain variances



Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

Experience supporting multi-state and international payroll

Prior experience in a high-growth or startup environment

Familiarity with payroll treatment for benefits, equity, and commissions



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

*Your application letter

*An unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

PayrollAccounting – YOUR FULL NAME



!!! Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

title: Video Editor Needed - Documentary/Behind the Scenes Travel Video to Seoul, South Korea
description:
Hello! I've just made a profile based off my friends recommendation to use this website. 



I have looked, looked and looked some more for a video editor for my project but have found it very hard. I have so much footage and it is a long video, many video editors didn't understand what I wanted. 



Here is the brief (it is obvious that I used chatgpt for this brief because every other brief I wrote myself, nobody seemed to understand the vibe or atmosphere of a video I wanted to create):



Objective:

Create a polished travel vlog from my footage in Seoul that feels cinematic, immersive, and story-driven, similar in vibe to the reference video I shared (YouTube link at the bottom). I want the viewer to feel like they’re experiencing Seoul with me, rather than just watching random clips.



???? Overall Style & Tone

• Vibe: Authentic, warm, cinematic travel storytelling — a mix of visual montage and voiceover narration that feels reflective and personal.

• Editing Style: Smooth pacing — not too fast like a flashy/viral style, but engaging enough to keep interest (think visual rhythm matched to music, subtle mood changes throughout the video).

• Color Grading: Natural with slight warmth — enhance city lights, food scenes, nightlife, and candid 
nts without overly heavy filters.

• Transitions: Clean cuts, some soft dissolves or film-like transitions where appropriate for mood shifts.



???? Narrative Structure

1. Intro (0:00–0:15)

• Establishing shots of Seoul — city skyline, streets, markets, your arrival, etc.

• Overlay a short intro voiceover (e.g., “I lived in Seoul for three years and love the people here etc;/I’m here for my friend’s wedding…”) — set the tone for the story.

2. Story Progression

I want the video to feel like a journey with emotional beats:

Section Visuals Voiceover

Seeing friends Footage of meetups, greetings, city walks Reflective, personal memories

Eating & food scenes Shots of plates, eating, street food Voiceover about favourite meals

Partying / nightlife Club clips, street scenes Personal commentary about experiences

Daily life & exploration Temples, markets, streets, trains Relating thoughts and mood

• Only use my speaking footage as voiceover commentary, never as full on-camera talking segments.

• Align visuals to the rhythm and emotion of the voiceover — emotional, real, conversational.



???? Audio & Music

• Music: Ambient, chill beats that enhance atmosphere but don’t overpower voiceover.

• Voiceover: Clear, balanced — place emphasis transitions between scenes.

• Sound Design: Include ambient sounds when useful (street noise, laughter, music in the background) but keep clarity of the voiceover.



???? Pacing & Feel

• Have visual pacing match the emotion of each section — slower and immersive during reflective parts, slightly more kinetic during fun outings.

• Avoid hyper–fast jump cuts. Let 
nts breathe.



???? Reference Inspiration

Here’s the link to a video with the vibe I love:

???? YouTube Reference: 

(The storytelling cadence, emotional pacing, and seamless integration of voiceover with visuals is the style I want to emulate.)



If you're interested I can tell you more over a Zoom chat.

About Us



We’re an Australia-based IT Managed Services & Security provider that has been helping businesses for 8+ years with Managed IT, Microsoft 365 Security, and Essential 8 compliance. We’re now on a mission to scale rapidly and are looking for a Senior PH Technical Lead who can own delivery discipline, enforce SOPs, and mentor the team while keeping clients secure.



The Role



This isn’t just another engineering job. You will be the backbone of our offshore team, ensuring tickets are triaged, SLA discipline is followed, and our security-first approach (M365 + Essential 8) is consistently applied.



Key Responsibilities



Triage & Ticket Discipline ? Own daily triage rotation, enforce SOPs, ensure zero tickets are left untriaged at EOD.

QA & Standards ? Review ticket quality, escalate misses, and enforce client comms standards.

M365 Security Leadership ? Drive improvements in Secure Score, Conditional Access, Intune, and Essential 8 L1 compliance.

Mentorship ? Guide and upskill junior PH engineers, enforce accountability.

Client Impact ? Collaborate with AU engineers to ensure top clients have strong security + reduced ticket backlog.



Requirements

3+ years MSP experience (non-negotiable). You must be comfortable with SLA-driven environments and ticketing systems (Halo, ConnectWise, Autotask, etc.).

Strong hands-on skills in:

 Microsoft 365 Admin, Security & Compliance, Intune, Conditional Access

 Essential 8 or similar cyber frameworks

Experience leading small teams or mentoring juniors.

Excellent written English for ticket notes + client comms.

Proactive mindset — you don’t wait, you enforce.



Why Join Us?



Career Pathway: Step into a Service Delivery Lead (PH) role as we grow.

Stable Company: 8+ years serving Australian businesses, strong client base.

Growth Mission: Be part of scaling rapidly — your impact will be visible.

Culture: We run on SOPs, discipline, and a no-blame mindset. If you want to grow, this is the place.



Compensation



Competitive salary PHP 70,000–120,000/month (depending on experience).

Performance bonuses for SLA discipline + client satisfaction.



How to Apply



Send your resume + 1-paragraph note on:

???? “How I have enforced SLA discipline or QA in a past MSP role.”

title: Virtual Receptionist VA (Remote) | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Senior Surgical Operations Coordinator (Remote, Full-Time)
description:
Ambulatory Surgery Center | Pre-Procedure Compliance | Healthcare Operations

We are hiring a full-time Senior Surgical Operations Coordinator to support our U.S.-based Ambulatory Surgery Center (ASC).

This is a non-clinical coordination role focused on documentation review, checklist management, and pre-procedure workflow support.

This position does not provide medical advice or independent clinical decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

Track labs, imaging, and clearance documents against ASC requirements

Communicate pre-approved preparation instructions to patients

Monitor anticoagulation documentation per physician instruction

Escalate incomplete or flagged cases to licensed U.S. clinical staff

Maintain structured tracking systems and compliance logs

Confirm readiness status prior to scheduled procedures

Required Background

3+ years healthcare experience (hospital, surgical, or perioperative setting preferred)

Strong understanding of surgical workflows and pre-procedure requirements

Excellent English communication

Highly detail-oriented and process-driven

Comfortable working within defined protocols

Able to follow direction precisely and escalate appropriately

Work Schedule

Full-Time

Monday–Friday

Must overlap with U.S. Eastern Time business hours

Compensation

$6-$8 USD per hour (based on experience)

Performance-based increases available for high performers.

Long-term stability within a growing healthcare organization.

Who Should Apply

Prefers structured operations over bedside care

KPIs (How We Measure Success)

• Client Retention: 30%+

• Maintain Client CPA under $40

• Secure video testimonials from 10%+ of clients

• High show-up rate for weekly calls

If you love measurable performance and winning – you’ll thrive here.



Who We’re Looking For

You speak fluent English with confidence. You can lead calls, manage objections, and build rapport quickly.

? Highly Organized

You track details, follow up on requests, and never let things fall through the cracks.

? Sales-Minded

You understand psychology and motivation. You can keep clients excited and committed long term.

? Analytical Problem Solver

When performance dips, you investigate fast and collaborate with the team to fix it.

? Ownership Mentality

 Ads)

• Experience running Zoom strategy calls



???? Compensation & Benefits

• Performance bonuses (hundreds to thousands monthly)

• Long-term, stable role

• Fully remote

• Work with a high-performing international team

• Real career growth opportunity

We reward performance. If you help clients win, you win.



Work Requirements

• Reliable high-speed internet

• Quiet home office setup

• Quality headset and camera

• Available during North American business hours



Why This Role Is Special

Most account management roles are reactive.

This one is proactive.

You will directly impact client growth, revenue, and retention.

You will be part of a company scaling aggressively.

You will grow with us.

title: HighLevel CRM Tech Specialist
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



Sell More Homes | Tech Specialist | Full-Time



Sell More Homes is a 7-figure marketing and coaching company that helps real estate agents across North America systemize their businesses, and close more deals using Meta/YouTube ads, HighLevel CRM, AI, and virtual assistants.



We’re looking for a Tech Specialist to join our winning team! If you're a pro at marketing tech, CRM systems, and love helping others succeed, this role might be for you.



What You’ll Do:



Onboard New Clients:

Serve as the first tech touchpoint for new clients. You'll walk them through onboarding sessions, help them set up or connect their Meta 
) ad accounts and HighLevel CRM.

Set up and customize HighLevel CRM accounts for new clients – including pipelines, automations, integrations, workflows, and more.

* Bonus: experience in real estate, digital marketing, or SaaS onboarding

* Work with passionate real estate professionals across North America

* 100% remote

Apply now and help shape the future of real estate in North America

title: Social Media Manager/Marketer
description:
Help Build Purpose-Led Businesses That Matter (and Convert)



You’re creative, yes — but you’re also strategic.

You don’t post for the sake of posting. You build trust, clarity, and momentum — and you know how to turn that into leads, bookings, and measurable growth.



We are building two fast-moving, purpose-led businesses. One focuses on empowering Indigenous entrepreneurs and community organisations. The other drives sustainable property development. Our work is values-driven, culturally aware, and trust-first.



We need a Social Media Manager & Growth Marketer who can help us show up with integrity and consistency — and convert interest into action (without sounding salesy or “marketing-ish”).



This is not a role for a task executor.

This is for someone who can collaborate with the Founder, protect the tone, and build a growth engine that compounds.



Why This Role Matters

 • Build trust with an audience that is cautious for good reason

 • Translate the Founder’s vision into content that feels human, grounded, and culturally safe

 • Create consistent momentum across channels (not random posting)

 • Generate leads that flow into our funnel: form ?
 ? booking ? delivery

 • Use data to improve what we do — without losing heart in the messaging



What You’ll Own



Pillar 1: Trust-First Content That Sounds Like Us

 • Write captions that are warm, direct, and emotionally intelligent

 • Avoid hype, gimmicks, or “internet marketer” tone

 • Speak to community with respect and clarity — we “walk alongside,” we don’t “sell at”

 • Repurpose insights, frameworks, and resources into posts that are easy to understand



Pillar 2: Lead Generation & Conversion

 • Drive traffic to booking links and lead magnets

 • Create simple campaign flows that convert (post ? DM/form ? nurture ? booked call)

 • Improve CTAs, hooks, and formats based on results

 • Collaborate with the systems lead to ensure content matches the funnel and
 sequences



Pillar 3: Publishing Rhythm & Community Engagement

 • Maintain a consistent posting cadence for the WhichWay FB page (and member community where relevant)

 • Plan weekly content aligned to priority themes, events, and offers

 • Encourage meaningful engagement: questions, prompts, feedback loops

 • Manage basic comment/DM responses using approved scripts and escalation rules



Pillar 4: Reporting & Optimisation (No Vanity Metrics)

 • Track what matters: reach, clicks, leads, bookings, and conversion rates

 • Share weekly insights: what worked, what didn’t, what we’ll change next

 • Test and iterate thoughtfully (not chaos)

 • Build a simple content library system so we’re not reinventing the wheel



You’ll Succeed If You

 • Are values-aligned and emotionally intelligent

 • Can write like a real human (not a brand robot)

 • Understand that trust is the conversion strategy

 • Can translate vision into content that’s consistent and clear

 • Think in systems: cadence, workflow, templates, repeatability

 • Can handle feedback well and protect the Founder’s voice

 • Enjoy both creativity and accountability



Success Looks Like

 • Consistent weekly content output aligned to our voice and priorities

 • Leads generated weekly (not just engagement)

 • Measurable improvement in click-through and booking conversion over time

 • A working content system we can hand off and scale

 • The Founder feels confident that the tone and integrity are protected

 • Community feels seen, respected, and supported



Must-Have Experience

 • Proven experience running social media with lead generation outcomes

 • Strong copywriting and audience-aware storytelling

 • Comfort with basic performance metrics and conversion thinking

 • Experience scheduling and managing posts (Meta Business Suite preferred)

 • Ability to collaborate, take initiative, and work without micromanagement



Strongly Preferred

 • Experience working with Indigenous communities or culturally sensitive audiences (or strong willingness to learn and follow guidance)

 • Experience integrating social content with funnels (forms,
 nurture, booking links)

 • Confidence turning long ideas into short, clear, human content



Pay & Perks



 • High-autonomy, high-trust role

 • Direct collaboration with the Founder and systems team

 • Purpose-led work with real-world outcomes

 • Room to grow as the businesses scale



How to Apply

Send us:

 • Your CV or LinkedIn profile

 • A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) answering:

 1. Why this work matters to you

 2. A campaign you ran that generated leads (what were the results?)

 3. How you protect brand voice and tone

 • 1–2 examples of posts or campaigns you’re proud of (with performance results if possible)



We are not hiring a person to “just post.”

We are looking for a thoughtful growth partner — someone who can build momentum, protect integrity, and generate leads in a way that feels aligned and human.

title: VA Accounting Assistant
description:
About You

You’re someone who brings positive energy to your work and enjoys being part of a collaborative, purpose-driven team. You’re friendly, approachable, and people feel comfortable coming to you with questions.



You care about doing things properly, you’re happy to jump in, help out, and figure things out as you go. You enjoy ticking things off a list, improving how things work, and knowing your work genuinely helps others.



Details

Reports to: Management Accountant

Employment Status: Full-time, permanent employee

Working Hours: AU Standard business hours and additional time as required by the role



Role Purpose

The Finance Support Officer is responsible for the end-to-end delivery of core transactional finance processes, including accounts payable, bank reconciliations, corporate cards, payroll processing, and financial data administration. This role is critical to the smooth running of the finance function, ensuring accurate, timely, high-quality financial processing that supports strong reporting, compliance, and organizational decision-making.



Role Responsibilities

A. Accounts Payable:

Process all supplier invoices, employee & volunteer expense claims, ensuring correct coding, approvals, GST treatment, currency, and documentation.

Manage the AP inbox and triage queries.

Maintain accurate supplier records, including bank details and documentation checks.

Prepare AP batches in line with cut-off timelines and approval workflows.

Conduct first-pass AP review before Management Accountant review (accuracy, completeness, coding).

Reconcile AP accounts and investigate variances.



B. Accounts Receivable:

Prepare and send invoices to partners, funders, and internal stakeholders.

Maintain AR schedules and follow up on outstanding amounts.

Reconcile AR balances and ensure all receipts are allocated.



C. Corporate Credit Cards:

Manage card issuance, cancellations, limits, and user onboarding.

Review monthly card claims, ensuring receipts, coding, and notes are provided.

Follow up late claims and unresolved discrepancies.

Reconcile company card accounts and ensure accurate EOM processing.



D. Payroll:

Prepare and process fortnightly payroll in line with contracts, and organisational policies.

Maintain employee master data with Xero, ensuring accuracy of bank details, tax information, superannuation, and entitlements.

Process new starters, changes, terminations, and pay adjustments.

Reconcile payroll reports, checking for variance and anomalies.

Prepare workpapers for superannuation payments, payroll journals, and leave reconciliations.

Work with P&E to ensure payroll accuracy, and timely updates to employee records.



E. Bank Reconciliation:

Complete daily and monthly bank reconciliations across all accounts.

Investigate and resolve unreconciled transactions.

Ensure all receipts, payments, and transfers are accurately recorded.



F. End of Month Processes:

Draft prepayments, accruals, apportionments, and routine journals.

Prepare EOM workpapers to a standard ready for first review.

Ensure all transactional processing is complete before close deadlines.

Maintain high-quality data hygiene to support forecasting, reporting, and analysis.



G. Data Entry and Record Keeping:

Maintain accurate, organised financial files and documentation for audit readiness.

Ensure data entry is correct, complete, and aligned with financial policies and accounting standards.

Support system updates, automation improvements, and process changes.



H. General Administrative Support:

Provide customer-focused support to internal stakeholders on finance and payroll queries.

Assist the Finance Team during peak periods (audit, EOFY, EOM, etc).

Participate in continuous improvement projects.

Contribute to team discussions on process optimisation, automation, and better ways of working.



Key Skills and Experience

-Experience in a finance support, accounts, or payroll role.

-Solid understanding of accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll processes.

-Proficient with Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets.

-Experience with accounting software (Xero preferred).

-Strong numeracy and data-entry accuracy.

-Understanding of basic accounting and payroll principles.

-High attention to detail and ability to deliver consistent accuracy.

-Excellent time management and ability to work to tight deadlines.

-Strong communication and customer service skills.

-Ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks.

-Comfortable with change, learning, and improving processes.

-Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion.

-Certificate, Diploma, or Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or related field

title: Social Media Funnel Manager / Organic Growth Strategist
description:
I'm looking for someone to build and manage a network of social media accounts across multiple platforms, all designed to organically funnel traffic to our main TikTok page and/or Shopify store.

The Concept:

Think parent and child accounts. The main account serves as the hub — the primary destination for purchases and brand identity. Supporting accounts across Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, and
 act as feeder channels, posting snippets, teasers, and engaging content that drives viewers back to the main page and converts them into customers.

Responsibilities include:



Creating and managing accounts across Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, and

Developing a cohesive cross-platform content strategy built around organic growth

Posting platform-optimized snippets and content that directs traffic to the main hub

Growing each account consistently and tracking performance across the funnel

Maintaining brand consistency in voice, aesthetic, and messaging across all accounts



Ideal candidate has:



Proven experience building and managing multi-account social media ecosystems

Deep understanding of organic growth strategies across all four platforms

Strong knowledge of each platform's algorithm and content best practices

Experience driving traffic to e-commerce stores through social content

The ability to create accounts independently or a trusted referral to someone who can handle account creation on your behalf

Self-starter mentality with minimal need for oversight



Important — Please Read Before Applying:

We will not be responsible for account creation. You must either have the capability to create and set up accounts yourself or be able to refer a trusted person who can. We will cover the cost of growth tools and any necessary paid resources, but we are specifically looking for candidates who already have this infrastructure and experience in place. If you cannot meet this requirement, please do not apply.

To Apply:

Share examples of accounts you've grown organically, your strategy for building a funnel like this, and your proposed compensation structure.

title: Social Media Manager (SMM) Specialist – Long-Term, Personal Brand Focus
description:
Do me a favor ---- Read the whole job post, and follow simple instructions. Appreciate you! 



Hey! I’m Draye.

I’ve been in the digital marketing industry for almost 2 decades, and I’ve worked with some big names you’d probably recognize—think Shark Tank sharks, top bestselling authors, and brands/entrepreneurs who take marketing seriously.

Now I’m looking for a solid, experienced SMM Specialist who can help me build my personal brand across multiple platforms—consistently, creatively, and with strategy (not random posting).

This is for someone who wants a long-term home and can focus on ONE main project (this one).



The Main Focus (First 3–6 Months)

For the first 3 to 6 months, your focus is 100% on MY PERSONAL BRAND across all platforms.

Once we’ve built a strong content engine, you may also start supporting my business pages (Redfern Media + Fractional CMO), but personal brand comes first.



Who This Is For

You’re a great fit if:

You have 3+ years experience as an SMM Specialist

You’ve worked in a digital marketing agency (required)

You can handle strategy + execution (not just posting)

You’re creative and can make content that doesn’t look “VA generic”

You’re confident editing videos for Reels, TikTok, Shorts, LinkedIn video, and YouTube

You know how to read analytics and actually improve performance



What You’ll Be Doing

1) Content Strategy + Planning

Build content pillars + weekly/monthly posting plan

Turn ideas into scroll-stopping posts

Repurpose content across platforms without it looking copy/paste

2) Posting + Engagement (Multi-Platform)

You’ll post and engage across:

Meta 
 + Instagram)

LinkedIn

YouTube

Google Business Profile

Other platforms as needed

Daily engagement includes comments, DMs, replies, community-building.

3) Creative Production (Design + Video)

• Design graphics/carousels (Canva + Adobe preferred)

• Video editing:

Short-form: Reels / TikTok / Shorts / LinkedIn video

Long-form: YouTube videos (basic clean edits, captions, pacing, etc.)

• Make content look premium and on-brand

4) Analytics + Reporting

• Weekly check-ins on performance

• Monthly report with:

What worked / what didn’t

Growth + engagement trends

Clear recommendations for next month



Important: This is NOT a “many clients” role

I’m looking for someone who can lock in on this project long-term and treat it like a real brand, not a side task.

If you’re juggling 3–5 clients already, this probably won’t work.



How to Apply

Apply here: 
/careers

Quick heads up—we shortlist fast. Just follow the simple instructions on the application page (it’s intentional). The people who follow directions usually end up being the best fit, and it helps us move you to the top ASAP.



If you’re the kind of person who can take ownership, create great content, and stay consistent long-term… I’m genuinely excited to start working with you.



Note: You’ll be working closely with me and my Chief of Staff, who’s been with me for 6 years. This role isn’t just “do what you like” — you’ll also learn how we operate from people who are strong in leadership, process management, and marketing, and you’ll level up fast if you’re coachable.



Draye Redfern

title: Executive Virtual Assistant
description:
Executive Virtual Assistant



Job Type: Full-Time

Job Overview: 

We are seeking a highly organized, proactive Executive Virtual Assistant to provide comprehensive support to a senior industry leader across both a consulting practice and a creative music career. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and enjoys balancing strategic business support with creative coordination.



The Executive Virtual Assistant will act as a trusted right hand, managing day-to-day operations, scheduling, communications, and project coordination. This position offers a unique opportunity to gain exposure to multifamily operations, PropTech, and consulting work, while also supporting initiatives within the music industry. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, resourceful, and comfortable handling multiple priorities with discretion and professionalism.

Preferred Qualifications:

Background in music industry marketing, artist management, or entertainment

Experience with invoicing, basic bookkeeping, or accounts receivable

title: Shopify Ecommerce Project Manager (Operations) – Manage VA + Dev + Media Buyer (Permanent Role)
description:
Summary

Our company is building a new Shopify ecommerce channel alongside our core store fixutres business. We already have two reliable local suppliers with stock ready to be dropshipped, with an initial catalog of ~1600 SKUs. Our goal is to launch fast with clean execution, then scale paid search.



WHAT WE NEED

We need an operator who can run the launch end-to-end and protect the founder’s time.



This is a full-time role, but if you’re a strong candidate with part-time availability, apply anyway. This is a long-term position—we plan to grow the store to 10,000 SKUs over time.



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR



* A performance marketer / media buyer (you will coordinate a specialist)

* A developer (you will coordinate a developer and QA the output)

* A general VA who only follows instructions (this role owns outcomes and deliverables)

* Someone who needs daily hand-holding or can’t show proof of similar work (SOPs, dashboards, launch plans, completed projects)



PROJECT SCOPE (WHAT YOU WILL MANAGE)



* Build and launch a Shopify store for ~1600 SKUs

* Manage VA(s) to upload products and enforce a QA checklist

* Coordinate competitor pricing inputs and keep pricing organized (rules + review)

* Set up and integrate automatic shipping costs based on package sizes/weights and carrier/rate apps that return the best available shipping rates

* Coordinate Google Ads launch with a media buyer (Search/Shopping)

* Coordinate with a developer to build supplier integrations (API) for live stock and order routing, including clear acceptance criteria and testing

* Coordinate perfect tracking setup (GA4/GTM/Ads conversions) with the media buyer/developer and verify with evidence

* Ensure the finished output works (testing + evidence), not just “it should work”



MUST-HAVE CAPABILITIES



* Strong project management: timelines, owners, follow-ups, and deadlines

* Ecommerce operations literacy: products, variants, collections, feeds, shipping rules

* Comfortable handling a large catalog (we’re launching ~1600 SKUs)

* Able to write clear specs/tickets for a developer and validate outputs with a test plan

* Can coordinate supplier API work (requirements, edge cases, acceptance criteria, UAT)

* Can coordinate and verify tracking (GA4/GTM/Google Ads) using evidence (test order, debug tools, screenshots)

* Can set up and maintain shipping rate logic (package sizes/weights, shipping profiles, carrier/rate apps, spot-checks)

* Comfortable communicating with suppliers and pushing for what you need

* Strong documentation: SOPs, checklists, and simple dashboards

* Calm execution: you don’t create chaos, you reduce it



TOOLS (PREFERRED)

Shopify, Google Sheets, Notion/ClickUp/Asana, Slack, Loom. Bonus if you’ve worked with Google Merchant Center and product feeds.



TIME ZONE

Must overlap at least 2 hours/day with 10 AM–5 PM Eastern Time (Toronto/New York).



PAY

Based on proof of ability. Include your expected hourly rate in your application.



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE



* We launch in 4–8 weeks once the website is live, with a clean catalog and stable operations

* Product uploads are consistent, accurate, and traceable (no guessing)

* Supplier inventory updates are reliable (stock accuracy + clear OOS behavior)

* Ads buyer gets what they need: clean feed, clean landing pages, clean tracking evidence

* Founder receives short weekly updates and only gets pulled in for key decisions



2-WEEK PAID TRIAL (HOW WE HIRE)

We will start with a 2-week paid trial. If you perform, this becomes long-term.



WHEN APPLYING

1. Start your message with: ECOM OPS

2. Confirm in one line:

   * Your hourly rate

   * How many hours are you available weekly 

   * You can overlap 2 hours/day with Eastern Time

3. Submit links to the qualifying questions when applying:

   * List the URL of the best ecommerce projects you supported, and describe your responsibilities in that project.

   * Record a short video of yourself, decribing your experience and why you're the right person for this role.



Do not send follow-ups. If you’re a fit, we will reply.

title: Amazon Product Researcher
description:
### **Virtual Assistant – Product Research & Brand Outreach (E-commerce / Wholesale)**



**About Us:**

We are a fast-growing e-commerce company specializing in wholesale and brand partnerships. Our business operates primarily on Amazon and we are expanding by building strong relationships with reputable brands and distributors.



**Position Overview:**

We are looking for a **Virtual Assistant (VA)** to join our team and support our wholesale operations. This role involves product research, contacting brands/distributors (via *
 and phone calls**), opening wholesale accounts, placing orders, and coordinating shipping with our warehouse.



**Key Responsibilities:**



* Conduct product research to identify profitable items and opportunities.

* Find and verify **legit brands and authorized distributors** for our niche.

* Reach out to brands/distributors via *
 and phone calls** to build partnerships.

* Assist in opening wholesale accounts and completing necessary paperwork.

* Place purchase orders and track order status.

* Coordinate logistics and shipping arrangements with our warehouse team.

* Maintain organized records of communications, accounts, and orders.



**Requirements:**



* **Fluent English** (both written and spoken) – this is mandatory.

* Previous VA experience in **e-commerce / wholesale / Amazon FBA** is highly preferred.

* Comfortable and confident making **phone calls** to suppliers/brands.

* Strong communication skills and professional phone etiquette.

* Familiarity with wholesale distribution and supplier outreach.

* Highly organized and detail-oriented.

* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks.

* Basic knowledge of spreadsheets (Google Sheets / Excel).



**Preferred Skills (not required but a plus):**



* Experience with Amazon Seller Central or Walmart Seller Center.

* Prior experience opening wholesale accounts.

* Understanding of logistics and freight coordination.



**What We Offer:**



* Long-term, full-time position with room for growth.

* Training and onboarding support.

* Flexible working hours (remote).

**Application Instructions:**

If you’re interested, please apply with:

2. A short description of your relevant experience.

Job Type: Full-Time

Job Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and execution-focused E-Commerce Specialist to support and optimize our direct-to-consumer online operations. This role works under the strategic direction of the E-Commerce Manager and is responsible for executing initiatives that drive online sales, improve conversion rates, and enhance overall site performance.



This hands-on position supports daily Shopify store operations, including merchandising, landing page creation, app management to improve customer experience,
 marketing campaigns, and SEO optimization. The ideal candidate is proactive, highly organized, and capable of managing multiple priorities effectively in a fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities



* Shopify and Product Management

Execute updates to pricing, product listings, homepage content, collections, and landing pages

Optimize product listings for SEO and conversions

Manage and implement Shopify apps to enhance site functionality and customer experience

Conduct Shopify store audits and recommend improvements

Troubleshoot and resolve site issues as needed



* Merchandising & Website Optimization

Execute merchandising strategies to highlight promotions and key products

Build and optimize campaign landing pages

Improve user experience and conversion flow through continuous testing and refinement

Monitor site performance metrics and identify optimization opportunities



* SEO & Site Performance

Lead on-page and off-page SEO initiatives, including keyword research, content optimization, and technical improvements

Conduct SEO audits and implement action plans

Monitor organic traffic, engaged sessions, and conversion metrics

Develop and communicate SEO strategies, milestones, and measurable outcomes

Continuously improving site performance to drive higher engagement and revenue



*

title: Content Manager/Content Curator – Video Podcast Remote
description:
Company Overview:

We are 37 Projects, a fast-growing YouTube Video Marketing Agency that helps health and wellness brands maximize their reach through high-quality video content, Shorts, and podcast marketing. We’re looking for a YouTube & Podcast Content Manager who can analyze long-form podcasts, craft compelling YouTube Shorts & Clips, and ensure all content aligns with the client’s brand voice and audience engagement strategies.



I. Content Manager Responsibilities



1. Content Consumption



- Watch 1–2 hour video podcasts on health, fitness, and nutrition topics.

- Develop a deep understanding of each podcast’s themes and key messages to inform content creation.



2. Clip & Short Identification (NOT Editing)



- Identify segments ideal for YouTube Clips and YouTube Shorts.

- Select the best 
nts for intros that build a compelling storytelling narrative.



3. Content Strategy & Quality Assurance



- Ensure all clips, shorts, and intros align with the client’s brand voice and content strategy.

- Perform content-only quality checks on first rough-cut videos (focus on flow, clarity, and messaging—not captions, graphics, or motion design).



4. Intros & Trailers



- Select punchy and engaging 
nts from the podcast to be used in the trailer (approx. 70–80 seconds).

- Provide editors with timestamps and key sentences to include, ensuring the trailer highlights the right topics or subtopics.

- Collaborate with the Project Manager and Video Editor to align on creative direction and client expectations.



Example: Similar to Steven Bartlett’s Diary of a CEO trailers, which combine intro narration with short, high-impact clips.



II. Scope of Work



- Manage content across five clients.

- Watch and process around 15–16 podcasts per month (on average, 3–4 per client).

- Produce selections for around 8 trailers per month (?2 per week, one per client).

- Deliverables include weekly clips, shorts, and trailers, ensuring consistency across all client channels.

- Collaborate closely with Project Managers and Video Editors to maintain smooth production flow and client satisfaction.



III Requirements:



1. Availability & Commitment:

- Full-time remote position - no other job commitments to ensure focus.

- Must have a high-performance laptop/computer and stable internet.



2. Experience & Education:

- Proven experience in video editing or podcast production (video/audio).

- Graduates in Communication, Multimedia, or Video Production are highly preferred.

- Experience in YouTube content creation (Shorts, Clips, long-form podcasts) - a bonus



3. Skills & Tools:

- SEO writing experience is a plus.

- Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects.

- Proficiency in:

   + Slack

   + Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

   + Notion

   + AI writing tools (ChatGPT, Claude)

   + YouTube SEO tools (VidIQ, SEMrush) – a bonus



4. Strong storytelling ability to identify and structure the most compelling 
nts in videos.



5. Preferred Bonus Skills:

- Knowledge of health, fitness, and nutrition topics (to select key 
nts effectively).

- Creative mindset with the ability to suggest innovative content formats & strategies.



???? How to Apply

???? Fill out this form to apply:

title: Project Manager / YouTube Podcast Producer (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
About Us



37 Projects is a fast-growing YouTube podcast marketing agency working with leading health, wellness, and performance brands (e.g., doctors, nutritionists, coaches, and creators).

We handle full post-production - from editing, SEO titles, and thumbnails to Shorts and publishing - helping clients grow from zero to hundreds of thousands of subscribers.



We’re looking for a Project Manager / Podcast Producer to manage two weekly podcasts and their related content.

This person will oversee production, review creative output, and ensure every piece, from full episodes to Shorts and thumbnails, aligns with the client’s brand identity, visual style, and storytelling tone.



This is a hybrid role: part creative producer, part project manager.

You’ll coordinate editors, review video quality, manage delivery timelines, and collaborate with our internal Creative Director and YouTube Strategist.



Responsibilities

Production & Coordination

- Oversee post-production for 2 podcasts per week, including:

  +2 full episodes (long-form)

  + 4 clips (3–10 minutes)

  + 10 Shorts (up to 60 seconds)

- Manage and coordinate between the Long-form Video Editor, Shorts Editor, Graphic Designer, and VA.

- Track and update tasks through Notion boards and Google Sheets production tracker.

- Review all 
 drafts, ensuring smooth communication and quick feedback cycles.

- Ensure editors meet deadlines and maintain consistent output quality.



Creative Oversight

- Review all deliverables for video quality, captions, and visual alignment with the client’s brand.

- Collaborate with the Creative Director on overall look and feel, ensuring videos reflect the right tone, pacing, and emotional flow.

- Guarantee that thumbnails align with the client’s visual branding (color palette, tone, layout consistency).

- Work closely with the YouTube Strategist who provides SEO titles and descriptions, ensuring the final uploads reflect both storytelling and search strategy.

- Maintain consistent quality standards across all episodes, clips, and Shorts.



Client Communication

- Act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients.

- Send regular progress updates and manage expectations clearly.

- Handle client feedback and ensure revisions are properly implemented.

- Communicate deadlines and deliverables clearly and professionally.



Admin & Reporting

- Update Notion boards daily with progress, feedback, and approvals.

- Monitor deadlines and coordinate with the VA for uploads, metadata, timestamps, and playlists.

- Collaborate with the team to identify creative or technical improvements.



Skills & Experience

- 2+ years of experience as a Project Manager, Producer, or Account Manager in a creative, media, or marketing agency.

- Strong understanding of video post-production and YouTube podcast workflows.

- Excellent communication skills (English written & verbal).

- High attention to detail and strong visual judgment — must have an eye for branding, quality, and storytelling flow.

- Experience using 
, Notion, Slack, Google Workspace, and similar tools.

- Organized, proactive, and able to manage multiple deadlines across teams.



Bonus Skills (Preferred, Not Required)

- Experience with YouTube or podcast video production.

- Basic understanding of YouTube SEO and content optimization.

- Familiarity with analytics, performance tracking, and CTR/retention metrics.

- Experience working with international clients (US, UK, AU).



What You’ll Get

- Work with top-tier health, performance, and wellness experts from around the world.

- Learn advanced YouTube strategy systems, production workflows, and creative processes used to scale shows from 0 to 100K+ subscribers.

- Join a high-performance, respectful, and growth-driven remote team.

- Opportunities for long-term growth within 37 Projects as we continue to expand.



How to apply

Please fill up this form without using any AI tools (in your own words). Candidates that will use AI will be disqualified.

description:

title: Administrative & Customer Experience Coordinator (Phone + Follow-Up + Marketing Support) Spanish a Plus
description:
About the Role



We’re a growing home-services business serving Long Island, NY. We’re hiring a remote Administrative & Customer Experience Coordinator to manage the front line of communication: inbound phone calls,
 inquiries, and customer follow-up.



Inbound volume is not nonstop—so when communications are lighter, you’ll also help with marketing/creative support and simple improvements that help the business grow (social posts, review requests, organizing before/after photos, basic promos).



Spanish speaking is a big plus because a large portion of our field team is Spanish-speaking, and you’ll occasionally help communicate schedules/details to the crew.



Key Responsibilities

1) Inbound Calls,
, and Customer Follow-Up (Top Priority)

- Answer inbound calls professionally and confidently (customer-first tone)

- Capture customer details, understand the request, and book estimates/appointments

- Respond to website leads and
s quickly and clearly

- Follow up consistently with:

New leads who haven’t booked

Customers after estimates to secure the job

Customers after service for satisfaction + review requests

- Maintain clean, accurate notes so nothing falls through the cracks



2) Scheduling + Internal Coordination

- Manage the schedule/calendar for estimates and jobs

- Send confirmations and reminders (templates provided)

- Coordinate updates with the owner/field team as needed

- Communicate job details to the crew through approved channels (text/WhatsApp, etc.)

- If bilingual: help translate key job details to/from Spanish when needed



3) Admin + Organization

- Keep customer info organized in our system (CRM/spreadsheet)

- Track lead status: new ? contacted ? scheduled ? pending ? booked ? completed

- Invoice/admin support as needed (depending on experience and workflow)

- Improve templates, checklists, and standard replies over time



4) Marketing + Creative Support (When Communication is Light)

- Collect/organize before-and-after photos from the field team

- Help with basic social media posting and message replies

- Create simple promo materials in Canva (flyers, service promos, seasonal specials)

- Send review requests and help build our online presence

- Track basic weekly metrics (calls/leads booked/reviews gained)



Required Qualifications

- Fluent English (spoken + written) — you will be speaking with U.S.-based customers

- Strong phone presence: friendly, professional, confident

- Extremely organized and reliable (follow-up is everything in this role)

- Comfortable with tech:
, calendars, spreadsheets, basic apps

- Able to work U.S. Eastern Time schedule consistently

- Comfortable making outbound follow-up calls (warm leads/customers)



Preferred (Big Plus)

- Spanish speaking (conversational or fluent)

- Experience supporting a U.S.-based service business (home services a plus)

- Familiarity with CRMs/scheduling tools (Jobber, Housecall Pro, etc.)

- Canva/social content experience



Remote Work Requirements

- Reliable high-speed internet and a dependable computer

- Quiet workspace suitable for professional phone calls

- Headset required for call quality

- Ability to learn and follow call scripts, workflows, and follow-up standards



How to Apply

Please send:

1) Your resume

2) Your availability (hours/time zone)

3) Are you able to work U.S. Eastern Time hours? (Yes/No)

4) Are you bilingual English/Spanish? If yes, level: basic / conversational / fluent

5) (Optional but preferred) A short writing sample:

- Reply to this: “Hi, I’m looking for an estimate. How much does it cost?”

6) 30–60 second voice recording introducing yourself (helps us evaluate phone presence)

title: Creative and Experienced Graphic Designer
description:
We are looking for a superstar to become our creative Graphic designer.



We are a fast growing set of entrepeneurs who are looking for a creative and articulate designer to help us quicly produce a range of content for our clients. The field is in Construction and we are looking for someone who can put together marketing material and Proposals that will sell using Canva or similar. 



We're looking for the best person available to begin on a job by job basis. 





We offer...



- Flexible working time meaning you can work whatever time of the day suits you as long as you can produce a fast turn around. 

- Working from your home. 

- Opportunities for repeat work



You will be given templates and images and required to make the material look modern and high end. 



This is a pay per job role which has the potential to grow. 

You Will...

- Have exceptional graphic design skills

- Be a creative thinker

- Have a good idea of what is modern in New Zealand trends/Western trends

- Able to work irregular hours and produce work quickly. 

- Have great English and be able to communicate well with our team here in New Zealand. 

- Have a detailed eye.

ing us with the subject line "I Create, You Renovate", and tell us, in 200 words why you would be a great fit for our company. title: Dispatcher
description:
Job Description



We are seeking a highly organized and reliable Dispatcher to coordinate daily schedules for our pressure washing technicians across Florida. This role is essential to ensuring jobs are assigned efficiently, customers are communicated with professionally, and crews are set up for success each day.



Key Responsibilities



-Schedule and dispatch pressure washing technicians based on location, job scope, and availability

-Monitor daily routes and adjust schedules for weather, delays, or urgent requests

-Serve as the main point of contact for technicians during active jobs

-Handle inbound and outbound customer calls professionally

-Confirm appointments and provide service updates to customers

-Manage work orders, job statuses, and invoices using scheduling software (Jobber experience is a plus)

-Maintain accurate customer records and daily dispatch logs

-Coordinate with management to ensure timely job completion and customer satisfaction



Qualifications



-Previous dispatcher, scheduling, or operations experience (home services preferred)

-Strong communication and customer service skills

-Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment

-Excellent organizational and time-management skills

-Comfortable using scheduling and CRM software (Jobber, ServiceTitan, or similar preferred)Reliable internet and phone (for -remote roles)

-okay to use Time Doctor as a time tracker

-A reliable internet connection with at least 30mbps and a computer with at least 8gb ram, windows 11 to perform work duties.

-2nd monitor is required





To apply, the following must be provided:

1. One minute video of you stating your name and why you think you should be hired.

2. Resume

4. What KPIs you believe are most important to tracking your success in this job

5. Your remote work environment

6. How long you have worked remotely

7. Is there any family, work or other distractions that would cause you to not be able to be on Zoom or Phone calls (new york timezone)?

8. Your desired rate of pay?

9. When you can start?



We provide PTO, holiday pay, health insurance, computer/monitor/headphone allowances and much more!
