title: Investigative Outreach and Seller Engagement Specialist
description:
URGENT HIRING: Investigative Outreach and Seller Engagement Specialist



US Real Estate | Remote

Market: California



DESCRIPTION:

We are a US based real estate solutions company helping homeowners facing complex situations such as pre-foreclosure, probate, inherited property, divorce, and financial hardship.



We are hiring a disciplined, emotionally intelligent Investigative Outreach and Seller Engagement Specialist to locate decision makers, build trust, and move sellers thoughtfully through early and mid stages of the buying process.



This is NOT a script-based cold calling job.

This is NOT churn and burn dialing.

This is investigative, relationship driven, and detail oriented work.



This role requires strong natural conversation skills. You must be able to think, listen, and respond intelligently without reading from scripts.



YOU WILL:

• Call and text 20 to 30 plus numbers per property

• Identify correct decision makers

• Map family relationships

• Speak with relatives when appropriate

• Build rapport with distressed homeowners

• Document everything clearly in CRM

• Follow up consistently and methodically

• Discuss situation, timeline, and general structure when appropriate

• Maintain seller engagement after leadership conversations

• Escalate to leadership when complexity requires



YOU MUST BE:

• Extremely organized

• Relentless with follow-up

• Emotionally steady

• Highly dependable

• Able to hold US conversational English clearly and naturally

• Able to communicate confidently and comfortably with American homeowners

• Capable of calm negotiation conversations

• Comfortable working independently

• Able to hold intelligent, unscripted conversations



Acquisition experience or negotiation skills are a plus if you are able to adapt to a relationship first approach and operate with patience and discipline. The ability to adjust tone based on stage of conversation is important.





COMPENSATION:

• Competitive hourly base based on experience and communication level

• Performance bonus per verified decision maker

• Bonus per qualified strategy appointment

• Bonus per closed deal

• High performers who assist in acquisition and contract execution can earn substantially more



Compensation will be discussed during the interview and structured based on experience, communication ability, and overall fit.



This role is designed to reward intelligence, discipline, and long term performance.

This role can begin part time and grow to full time based on performance.





HOW TO APPLY:

To be considered, you MUST complete ALL steps below. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



Step 1:
 resume in PDF format



Step 2: Voice Recording (60 to 90 seconds)

Answer this question:

“How would you calmly contact a relative to locate a property owner who may be in financial distress?”

Submit as MP3 or Google Drive link.



Step 3: Answer these scenarios in writing.

A. You receive 25 phone numbers tied to one property. Most are wrong. Explain your exact step by step strategy to locate the correct decision maker.

B. A homeowner says, “I’m not interested” and tries to hang up. What do you say next?

C. How do you track and manage long term follow up for multiple properties?



Step 4: Include the phrase: Precision Over Volume in your
 subject line.



Step 5: Visit: 

In one paragraph, explain what makes the company owner different from a typical real estate investor. At the beginning of your paragraph, you must clearly state the owner’s full name.



Send all materials to:

title: Part Time Social Media Content Creator
description:
I own a small digital marketing agency in the U.S. and am looking for a social media content creator.  We mainly focus on local home service businesses such as landscaping, plumbing and roofing).  This role is for 10 - 20 hours per week.



The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and executing a content strategy across
 and Instagram with the primary goal of increasing customer engagement, driving traffic to our website, and boosting the brands of our clients online.



This role is primarily focused on creating compelling image based posts although experience with video editing is a plus.



Key Responsibilities:



* Content Creation: Develop and produce engaging, on-brand content using photos and other assets provided by our clients.



* Develop a monthly content calendar for each client.



* Scheduling and Publishing: Plan, create, and schedule all social media posts in advance to ensure a consistent and reliable content flow.



Qualifications:



* Proven experience in a social media management or content creation role.



* Excellent communication and writing skills.



* Creative mindset with the ability to turn ideas into visually compelling content.



* Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.



This is a part-time position with flexible hours. If you're a self-starter with a knack for creating content that converts, we'd love to hear from you!



To apply please answer the following questions and also provide a resume.  Please do not use AI to respond to this application. If your application is AI generated or relies on answers that are AI generated it will be ignored. Set the subject line to Social Media Content Creator Application. Please only respond through OnlineJobs.ph, not through other channels.



1. Do you have any experience doing postings for home service businesses?  If so what types of businesses?  Please provide a link to any examples.



2. What do you use to edit graphics?  Please provide examples of social media posts that you have created that showcase your level of graphic design experience.

5. Do you have any experience editing video and if so what are some examples?  Note that this is not required of this position but it would be nice to have someone with this experience in case we want to start doing more with video.

title: Video Editor Team Lead
description:
Video Editing Team Lead (Short-Form & Reels)

Role Overview



The Video Editing Team Lead is responsible for leading and coaching a team of video editors while remaining hands-on in script development, storytelling, and high-quality short-form video production. This role ensures that all video outputs meet creative, technical, and client standards, particularly for reels and short-form content.

Creative & Storytelling

Ensure strong storytelling, flow, and engagement within limited durations

Guide editors on narrative structure for reels and social videos





Video Production & Editing

Deliverables

Skills & Requirements

title: Conversation Insight & Content Extraction Assistant (Real Estate Educational Content)
description:
Overview:

I am an experienced real estate agent building a library of client education videos and social media lessons based on buyer consultations, Loom walkthroughs, and client communication throughout the transaction process.



I am looking for someone who can review recordings, Loom videos, and
s to extract recurring questions, emotional concerns and moments . Organize them into rough lesson ideas and scripts that reflect my authentic voice. Once the content is approved create educational videos with animation that is drawn as the content is shared.



This role is NOT a typical virtual assistant position. It is closer to insight extraction, pattern recognition, and thoughtful content organization.



Your goal is to help capture my natural teaching style so it can be turned into short, branded, educational videos and social media lessons consistent with our company style: Living Room Real Estate.



Responsibilities:

- Review buyer consultation recordings to identify recurring questions, emotional friction points, and reassurance opportunities

- Analyze Loom property walkthrough videos to capture explanations, analogies, and decision-making frameworks

- Review milestone and process
s (“what just happened / what’s next”) to map client expectations and emotional needs

- Organize insights into short educational video ideas (2–4 minutes each)

- Draft rough scripts using my actual phrasing whenever possible

- Suggest simple animation or visual concepts for each lesson

- Ensure content is structured so it can be turned into videos that are consistent with our branding, colors, fonts, and logo

- Identify opportunities for both client education videos and social media micro-lessons



Initial Projects Include:

- A video showing what it’s like to work with my team

- Questions buyers should ask when selecting a real estate agent

- A 5-step overview of the transaction process (sent after offer acceptance)

- Individual milestone explanation videos (inspection, appraisal, underwriting, closing, etc.)

- Social media lessons designed to attract and educate future clients



Skills & Requirements:

- Strong English comprehension and writing skills

- Excellent listening and observational skills to identify patterns and emotional nuance

- Ability to extract key insights from video recordings, Loom walkthroughs, and written
s

- Experience drafting structured scripts or lesson outlines from source material

- High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

- Ability to preserve someone else’s voice and tone accurately

- Comfortable working asynchronously and following a defined workflow

- Experience with content creation, educational content, or scriptwriting is a plus

- Basic understanding of real estate terminology is helpful but not required

- Proactive communication and responsiveness



Programs/Tools & Video Production Familiarity:

- Google Drive – for organizing and accessing recordings,
s, and reference files

- Loom – for reviewing videos and providing/receiving feedback

- Google Docs – for drafting and organizing scripts

- Animation platforms such as Vyond, VideoScribe, Animaker, or Doodl



Important: 

- This role is not just about using these tools. The primary goal is to pull the most important educational content from our recordings,
s, and Loom walkthroughs, and help translate it into short videos that are:

- Branded with our logo, colors, and fonts

- Consistent with our company branding and visual style (Living Room Real Estate)

- Structured for educational clarity, emotional reassurance, and client engagement

- Ready to hand off to a designer/animator for final video production

- Familiarity with animation platforms such as Vyond, VideoScribe, Animaker, or Doodly



Workflow Overview:

- Each week, you will review 4-5 recordings, Loom videos, or milestone
s



Produce a short insight document with:

- Key themes and repeated client concerns

- Suggested lesson ideas

- Rough scripts using my phrasing

- Visual/animation suggestions



I will respond with a short Loom video giving quick feedback (accuracy, tone, emphasis, and pacing)

This workflow is designed to minimize my time working on this project while preserving authenticity and quality.



Ideal Candidate:

- Detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing multiple sources of information

- Emotionally intelligent — able to detect client concerns and teaching opportunities

- Self-motivated and able to work asynchronously

- Able to maintain tone and voice without rewriting content generically



To Apply:

- Provide a brief description of any experience reviewing recordings or extracting insights from conversations

- Include an example of educational or structured content you have helped organize and an example of a cartoon video, you made, that is drawn while the narrator talks. (if available)

- Write a short explanation of how you would preserve someone’s voice when creating content from transcripts

title: YouTube Editor
description:
Location: Remote

Type: Part-time contractor (with potential to grow)

Compensation: Competitive monthly retainer based on experience



About Me & The Business



I run a high-ticket coaching program that helps people dramatically reduce or eliminate daily anxiety and feel “calm and normal” again. We work mostly with people who’ve tried the usual advice and still wake up with a racing mind and tight chest.



I’m rebuilding the business around a simple, direct-response funnel:



Paid ads ? application ? booked call ? client



Content is a key part of that. I do weekly livestreams, client sessions, and trainings. I need someone who can turn that raw footage into clear, compelling assets that build trust and book more calls.



The Role



You’ll be my core video editor. Your job is NOT to make things “cinematic.” Your job is to:



Turn my raw content (livestreams + client calls + proof) into videos that keep attention and help lower CAC (cost to acquire a client).



Weekly, you will:



Take 1 long-form piece (usually a Thursday live or training)

Take selected client sessions / proof clips

Deliver a set of finished assets that can be used in:

YouTube / podcast

Social / ads

Lead nurture (texts/emails before calls)

Your Responsibilities



Every week you will:



Create 1 long-form video (8–15 minutes)



Teaching, breakdown, or case study.

Clean structure: hook, context, teaching, examples, CTA.

Create 2–3 short-form videos (30–90 seconds each)



At least one is a concrete client win / testimonial.

At least one is a “tiny win” or reframe that anxious people can use immediately.

Optionally one objection-buster (time, money, “I’ve tried everything,” etc.).

Edit for clarity and retention



Strong hooks in first 1–3 seconds.

Tight pacing, no fluff.

Simple captions, titles, and pattern interrupts that help understanding, not distract.

Be self-managing



Take a clear brief and turn it into finished assets with minimal back-and-forth.

Organize files and deliverables logically each week.

Hit deadlines consistently.

You Are a Fit If…



You have 2+ years editing long and short-form video for online creators, coaches, or info products.

You understand direct-response style content: hooks, offers, CTAs, proof.

You care more about watch time, clarity, and sales impact than fancy transitions.

You can work from a Loom brief or written notes without needing your hand held.

You can hit a weekly content pack on time, every time.

Big plus if:



You’ve edited content in the mental health / self-improvement / coaching space.

You can show before/after examples of how you improved pacing, hooks, or structure.

What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)



Every week, I get:

1 long-form video and 2–3 shorts that I can post or use in ads with no major edits.

We start to see:

Better hooks and watch time on content,

Strong proof assets we can plug into landing pages and ads,

A growing library of usable clips from client wins.

title: Systeme IO VA Specialist Web Designer
description:
Duration: ~10 days from project start (with possible extension)

Start date: As soon as possible



About the project

We are launching a new digital products store hosted on Systeme IO, connected to a subpage of our existing website. The initial launch includes 7 digital products. Two products are almost ready; the remaining products will be created by us and handed off to you to set up and publish (roughly one product per day).



We already have:



Brand guidelines



Welcome
 sequences



Clear launch date and structure



We now need a detail?oriented VA who can handle the build and implementation inside Systeme IO and Canva for muckups.



Your primary outcomes

By the end of the project, you will have:



Set up our Systeme IO environment and basic funnel structure for a digital product store.



Listed and configured 7 digital products (pages/sections, checkout, delivery, and basic automations).



Implemented and connected simple
 sequences to the correct triggers and tags.



Ensured the entire journey from opt?in or product page visit to purchase and delivery is smooth and tested.



Key responsibilities

Systeme IO setup & funnels



Configure account basics (settings, sender
, domain/subdomain if needed).



Create the main funnel structure (store page, product pages/sections, checkout pages, thank?you pages).



Set up and manage tags, lists, and basic automations (e.g., opt?in ? tag + welcome sequence, purchase ? tag + post?purchase
s).



Digital product listing & delivery



For each product (we provide the files and key info):



Create the product/offer inside Systeme IO.



Upload files and set up access/delivery.



Connect to the appropriate checkout page and pricing.



Ensure correct tags and follow?up automations are applied.



Test the full flow for each product (page ? checkout ? confirmation ?
 ? access).



 sequences



Create campaigns and load our existing welcome and launch sequences.



Format
s for readability, add buttons/links, and connect them to the correct funnels and triggers.



Support minor copy adjustments if needed (with guidance) and ensure everything is scheduled correctly.



Canva & visuals



Use our brand guidelines to create and/or adapt:



Product covers and mockups



Simple page/section visuals for the digital store and product pages



Export and upload graphics into Systeme IO, maintaining consistency across products and pages.



Documentation & communication



Document what you build (tags used, automations set up, funnel names/paths) so the system is clear and manageable.



Provide daily short updates at the beginning of the project (completed / in progress/questions).



Later in the project, proactively suggest improvements and manage your own task list within the agreed scope.



Requirements

Must?have



Proven experience working inside Systeme IO (please share examples or screenshots):



Funnels/pages



Products/offers



 campaigns and automations



Canva proficiency (product mockups, simple marketing graphics, on?brand designs).



Comfortable using AI tools to draft or refine copy for product descriptions, FAQs, and basic page text. (AI pro provided)



Strong attention to detail and ability to follow brand guidelines.



Reliable communication, with at least a small overlap in working hours with US Eastern Time.



Ability to work part?time for the duration of the project (a few hours per day) and meet a 10?day launch timeline.



Nice?to?have



Experience with digital product launches (courses, templates, workbooks, etc.).



Basic copywriting and understanding of conversion?focused page structure.



Experience documenting systems and creating simple SOPs.



Work style & collaboration

You will receive clear priorities and tasks from the founder/strategist daily at the beginning of the project.



As the scope becomes clear, you’ll be expected to work more independently, planning your own tasks within the agreed goals.



Strategist will be available for feedback and check-ins. Communication will be primarily async (chat (WhatsApp) + Google Meet+
), with occasional short calls if needed.

title: Real Estate Market Analysis
description:
Position Overview



We are seeking a detail-driven Real Estate Analyst to support our growing real estate operation by generating and interpreting RPR (Realtors Property Resource) Reports for every listing.



This role is responsible for delivering accurate, data-backed property insights that help us price strategically, market effectively, and present strong value to sellers and buyers.



The ideal candidate is analytical, organized, efficient, and understands real estate data inside and out.



Key Responsibilities



RPR & Property Analysis



* Run full RPR Reports for all new listings

* Generate Seller’s Reports, Property Reports, and Market Activity Reports

* Analyze comparable sales (active, pending, sold)

* Evaluate pricing trends and absorption rates

* Review neighborhood market statistics



Strategic Insights



* Provide pricing recommendations based on data

* Identify overpricing or underpricing risks

* Highlight property strengths and market positioning opportunities

* Provide a written summary of findings for listing presentations



Market Intelligence



* Track local market shifts weekly

* Monitor DOM trends and price reductions

* Identify competing listings and strategic positioning advantages

* Provide monthly market snapshots



Organization & Reporting



* Deliver reports within 24–48 hours of listing intake

* Maintain organized digital files for all properties

* Ensure data accuracy and compliance







Qualifications



* Active Real Estate License (Preferred but not required)

* Experience using **RPR, MLS systems, and CMA tools**

* Strong understanding of residential market trends

* Excellent analytical and written communication skills

* High attention to detail

* Ability to meet deadlines consistently

* Proficient in Excel / Google Sheets



 Ideal Candidate Traits



* Data-driven thinker

* Strategic mindset

* Self-motivated

* Organized and process-oriented

* Comfortable working independently

* Understands pricing psychology



This position will grow into a full time position within 4 weeks once we get the process systemized.

title: Family Law Paralegal
description:
The Family Law Paralegal will provide comprehensive litigation support in complex divorce, custody, child support, and post-decree matters. The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, and capable of managing sensitive cases with professionalism and discretion.



Key Responsibilities



Draft pleadings, motions, financial disclosures, and discovery requests/responses

Prepare and organize financial affidavits and supporting documentation

Manage case files from intake through trial and post-decree proceedings

Communicate with clients, opposing counsel, court staff, and third parties

Assist in trial preparation, including exhibit organization and witness coordination

Maintain calendaring of court deadlines and ensure compliance with procedural rules

Coordinate mediation, hearings, and depositions

Conduct legal research as needed

title: API Developer & Systems Integrator
description:
About the Role:

We are seeking a skilled API Developer & Systems Integrator to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the critical connections between our core software platforms. You will bridge the gap between disparate systems—from CRMs and property management systems (PMS) to modern AI and automation tools ensuring seamless data flow and operational efficiency. 



The ideal candidate is proficient in modern programming languages, has a strong grasp of database architecture, and possesses a passion for leveraging low-code automation platforms and cutting-edge AI technologies to solve complex business challenges. 





Key Responsibilities:

• API Development & Management: Design, build, and maintain scalable RESTful APIs and webhooks to facilitate communication between internal and external systems. 

• Systems Integration: Lead integration projects with third-party platforms, including CRMs, PMS solutions, and communication tools (Twilio, Vonage). 

• Automation & Workflow: Develop and maintain automated workflows using platforms like n8n, Make, Zapier, and the Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps) to streamline business processes. 

• Data Engineering & Reporting: Write complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data. Build and maintain interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI to provide stakeholders with actionable insights. 

• Cloud & Infrastructure: Utilize Microsoft Azure services (including Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and App Services) to deploy and manage integration solutions. Leverage Microsoft Fabric for data integration and analytics where 

applicable. 

• AI & LLM Integration: Experiment with and implement solutions utilizing Large Language Models (LLMs) by integrating with OpenAI API, Azure AI, and other voice AI platforms (VAPI). 

• Code Maintenance: Write clean, maintainable code in Python or JavaScript/Node.js to support custom integration logic that goes beyond low-code capabilities.



Required Skills & Qualifications 

• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent practical experience. 

• Programming: Proficiency in at least one modern language: Python or JavaScript/Node.js. 

• Database: Strong working knowledge of SQL for querying, data manipulation, and performance optimization. 

• Cloud: Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure services (Functions, Logic Apps, Storage). 

• Reporting: Proven experience building reports and dashboards in Power BI. 

• Integration Logic: Deep understanding of webhooks, event-driven architecture, and API security protocols (OAuth, API Keys).



Preferred Experience 

• Automation Platforms: Experience building workflows with n8n, Zapier, Make (Integromat). 

• Microsoft Stack: Proficiency with the Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate/Flow, Power Apps) and Microsoft Fabric. 

• AI & Voice: Experience integrating with Voice AI platforms (VAPI, Twilio, Vonage) or AI/LLM APIs (OpenAI, Azure AI). 

• Domain Expertise: Previous experience integrating with Property Management Systems (PMS) or CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Dynamics 365). 

• Azure Advanced: Experience developing with Azure Apps and navigating the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem.

title: Appointment Setter (Night Shift) – Selling the Future of Labor (Teleoperated Robotics)
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines-based)



Shift: 12:00 AM – 9:00 AM Manila Time (PST Business Hours)



Duration: 2 - 4 weeks.



Pay: Hourly + Bonus for every successful meeting scheduled. 



The Project



I am running a market experiment to solve the labor shortage in major US cities (Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles). The concept is "Remote-Piloted Labor"—using pilots in the Philippines to operate robots that stock shelves in US stores.



I have not built the hardware yet. This is a test to see if US store managers are interested in this service before I move into production. I need a scrappy, smart caller to help me find out if this is a business worth building.



The Role



Your job isn't to "sell" a product; it’s to gauge interest and book test runs. You will be my boots on the ground (via the phone) to find out which managers are desperate for help and willing to try a futuristic solution.



Lead Hunting: Use Indeed and Google to find stores/warehouses in Seattle, SF, and LA that are "Urgently Hiring" for night-shift stockers.



Cold Calling: Call these managers and present the concept.



Data Collection: I need you to take detailed notes. If they say "No," I want to know exactly why. Is it safety? Price? Or do they just not believe it?



The Win: Getting a manager to agree to a 15-minute follow-up call with me to discuss a future test run.



Requirements



You must be able to hold a real conversation. If you sound like you are reading a script, this won't work.



You need to be able to "read" the manager’s tone and pivot the conversation.



Professional headset, quiet workspace, and stable fiber internet.



Since this is a solo experiment, I need someone who doesn't need constant hand-holding.



?? HOW TO APPLY (2-Minute max Voice Memo) ??



Do not send a cover letter. I only care about how you sound on the phone. Send a 180-second voice memo with the following:



1 - Briefly summarize your US cold-calling experience.



2- How will you find the direct phone numbers of store managers in Seattle for free?



3 - What tools will you use? What VoIP?



4 - Pitch me the "Remote-Piloted Stocker" concept in 2 sentences.



5 - Tell me one reason you think this experiment might be difficult and how you’ll handle it.



Applications without this voice memo will be ignored. Let’s find out if this business works :)

title: E-commerce Operations & Support Assistant (Remote | Part-Time 20 hrs/week)
description:
Company: Black Voyage (US e-commerce brand)

Location: Remote

Type: Part-Time (20 hrs/week) with strong potential for Full-Time

Pay: $3.50 – $5.00 USD/hour (based on experience) + raises for high performers



Quick Highlights

Flexible part-time (20 hrs/week) with clear priorities and manageable scope

Weekly sync 1–2x/week (10:00–11:00 AM Manila time) — no daily night shifts

Clear SOPs, templates, and dashboards — you’ll know exactly what “good” looks like

Mix of Customer Support + Operations + light Influencer support (guided by templates)



About Black Voyage

Black Voyage is a fast-growing US e-commerce brand specializing in premium vacuum compression travel gear. In our first year, we achieved multi-million USD revenue across Amazon and Shopify. Our customers are frequent travelers who care deeply about design, efficiency, and smart packing.

We’re a small, fast-moving team that values:

clarity, ownership, empathy, and high-quality communication.



Schedule

Flexible hours, with availability for a weekly team sync (1–2x/week) during Manila/Taiwan time 10:00–11:00 AM.

In most weeks, you’ll receive written task instructions after the sync; live attendance may not always be required.



Role Overview

We’re hiring a sharp, emotionally intelligent assistant to support our day-to-day execution across Customer Support and Operations — with some light influencer support.

This is not a “copy-paste script” job. We want someone who can follow SOPs and think clearly when situations aren’t perfectly standard.

Focus Split (Typical)

Customer Support & Risk Handling: ~50–60%

Operations / Admin Support (tracking, dashboards, logistics follow-ups): ~30–40%

Influencer Support (research + outreach support using templates): ~10–15%



What You’ll Do

1) Customer Support & Customer Experience

Reply to customer inquiries (shipping, delivery, refunds, warranty, complaints) with a warm, empathetic, professional tone

Handle sensitive cases calmly (angry customers, confusion, refund demands)

Protect the business from disputes/chargebacks by following SOPs and documenting clearly

2) Risk & Priority Management

Flag and escalate high-risk issues (potential disputes, 1-star review threats, shipping delays)

Prioritize your inbox and keep cases moving without losing details

3) Operations & Admin Support

Update trackers and dashboards (Google Sheets / Notion)

Track orders and basic logistics follow-ups

Help maintain clean records so the team always has accurate information

4) Influencer / Growth Support (Template-Guided)

Help identify potential creators and record key data in our master sheets

Assist with initial outreach, follow-ups, and basic negotiation steps using our guidelines

Track product seeding shipments and posting deadlines



Who You Are

Excellent written English (you can switch tone: warm & professional for customers; friendly & confident for creators)

Detail-oriented and structured (you can handle 30+
s/day without dropping threads)

Emotionally intelligent (you can de-escalate, stay calm, and choose the right level of firmness)

Resourceful problem-solver (you try to find the answer first, then ask smart questions when needed)

Tech-comfortable (Shopify + Gorgias/Zendesk + Google Workspace is a plus, but not required)



How to Apply (Single-Step — Please Follow Exactly)

We’re looking for candidates with strong attention to detail. Applications that don’t follow instructions may be ignored.

 
 with the subject line:

E-commerce Assistant – [Your Full Name] – [Your Favorite Travel Destination]

Example: E-commerce Assistant – Maria Cruz – Japan

In your
, include ALL 3 items below:

1) Resume

Attach as PDF or share a link.

2) 1–2 Minute Loom Video

Briefly introduce yourself and answer:

“Tell us about a time you had to solve a problem at work without clear instructions. What did you do?”

3) Written Exercise (Copy & Paste Answers into the
)

Task A (Customer Support – Chargeback Prevention)

A customer is furious. They
:

“I never received my package! You guys stole my money. Refund me immediately or I'm calling my bank!”

You check tracking and it shows Delivered, with a clear Proof of Delivery (POD) photo showing the package at their front door.

Write your reply.

Goal: De-escalate their anger, show empathy, reduce chargeback risk, provide the POD info, and guide next steps.





Task B (Influencer Negotiation – Low Engagement Pivot)

An influencer with 100,000 Instagram followers replies:

“I'd love to work together! My rate for one dedicated Reel is $800.”

Your research shows very low engagement (~0.5%, ~500 likes per post).

Write your reply.

Goal: Decline the $800 fee politely (without offending them), and pivot to a performance-based option (Free Product + Affiliate Commission).



Technical Requirements (Must Have)

Reliable internet (minimum 20 Mbps)

Backup internet option (mobile hotspot is fine)

Laptop/PC capable of multitasking



Interview Process

Shortlisted candidates will be invited to a single interview. No second-round assignments.

title: TikTok Ad Specialist
description:
TikTok Ads Specialist

Company: CartKaboom

 Location: Remote

 Type: Contract / Full-Time (flexible based on experience)



About CartKaboom

CartKaboom helps ecommerce brands scale fast through performance-driven marketing. We specialize in paid media that converts—especially on platforms that move quickly and reward creativity (hello, TikTok). We’re looking for a TikTok Ads Specialist who knows how to turn scrolls into sales.



Role Overview

We’re seeking a results-oriented TikTok Ads Specialist to manage and scale paid TikTok campaigns for ecommerce brands. This role is perfect for someone who understands TikTok culture, creative testing, and performance metrics—and knows how to balance data with creativity. You’ll be responsible for the full lifecycle of TikTok ad campaigns, from strategy and setup to optimization and reporting.



Responsibilities

- Build, launch, and manage TikTok ad campaigns for ecommerce brands

- Develop paid media strategies aligned with client goals (ROAS, CPA, scaling)

- Research audiences, hooks, trends, and competitors

- Collaborate on ad creatives (UGC-style videos, hooks, angles, CTAs)

- Test creatives, audiences, and bidding strategies to improve performance

- Monitor performance daily and optimize for conversions and ROAS

- Set up and manage TikTok Pixel and events

- Analyze data and provide clear performance reports and insights

- Stay up to date on TikTok trends, ad formats, and platform updates

- Inventory Management



Requirements

- Proven experience running TikTok ads for ecommerce brands

- Strong understanding of TikTok Ads Manager and campaign structure

- Experience with creative testing frameworks and scaling strategies

- Ability to read data and make confident optimization decisions

- Familiarity with UGC-style ads and TikTok-native content

- Strong communication and time-management skills

- Ability to work independently and hit performance targets



Nice to Have

- Experience managing $10k+/month ad spend

- Experience with Shopify, GA4, or other analytics tools

- Copywriting experience for short-form video ads

- Prior agency or DTC brand experience



What We Offer

- Remote flexibility

- Opportunity to work with fast-growing ecommerce brands

- Performance-based growth opportunities

- A creative, results-focused team that moves quickly



How to Apply

Please include:

- A brief overview of your TikTok ads experience

- Examples or case studies of campaigns you’ve managed

- Monthly ad spend ranges you’ve handled

- Your availability and preferred working arrangement

title: Sr. Google Ads Manager
description:
SalesX is a heavily automated, KPI-driven Google Ads agency. Our systems process and monitor hundreds of thousands to millions of signals continuously. This role exists to watch the system, spot what’s wrong, fix it fast, and push performance forward.



This is not a busy-work role. Busy work is automated.

We reward speed, judgment, and results.



Core Loop

Watch ? Correct ? Create

Repeat daily.



What you will do

- Monitor live Google Ads performance across automated systems and KPI dashboards

- Spot anomalies, inefficiencies, and “something’s off” 
nts before damage compounds

- Take fast corrective action to protect spend, performance, and client outcomes

- Verify automation behavior and flag issues when outputs do not match intent

- Drive KPI improvement (CPA, ROAS, efficiency, scale) through decisive intervention

- Generate 5–7 strong, testable campaign or structure ideas daily

- Influence account direction and experimentation strategy at a senior level



What we expect

- Proven history managing meaningful Google Ads spend

- Strong intuition for when data looks wrong even if no alert fires

- Comfort operating in automated environments with layered checks and scripts

- Ability to act calmly when things are on fire and stay hands-off when they’re not

- KPI-first mindset with creative execution ability

- Senior judgment over task execution





If you’re someone who can watch complex systems, catch problems early, fix them fast, and consistently create new growth paths, you’ll thrive at SalesX.

title: Data Analyst
description:
DAP Brands is looking for a sharp, detail-oriented, and analytical Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. If you're passionate about transforming complex data into actionable insights and creating impactful reports, we’d love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities

- Gather, structure, and analyze large volumes of data from multiple sources.

- Design, maintain, and optimize databases, data systems, and warehouses.

- Apply statistical techniques to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.

- Identify patterns, trends, and correlations in complex datasets.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define key metrics and reporting needs.

- Implement data collection systems and strategies to improve data quality and efficiency.

- Develop visualizations and dashboards to support business initiatives.

- Communicate findings clearly and effectively to stakeholders at all levels.



Qualifications:

- Minimum of 2 years' experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.

- Strong understanding of data models, database development, data mining, and segmentation.

- Proficient with SQL and reporting tools (e.g., Business Objects), and knowledgeable in ETL processes.

- Experience with statistical software such as Excel, SPSS, SAS, or similar tools.

- Skilled in programming or scripting languages (e.g., JavaScript, XML).

- Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities with close attention to detail.

- Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to translate data into insights.



Final Note

This role is for someone who wants to build, not just assist.

If you move fast, operate at a high standard, and want to be part of building something that matters…

title: Creative Video Editor
description:
About Us:



Our content spans humorous skits, engaging storytelling, and social-first video formats that captivate millions of viewers across platforms. The work we create is defined by its bold creativity, shareable ideas, and ability to connect with audiences through laughter, relatability, and clever visual narrative. With a global audience and billions of cumulative views, our channels are a hub for comedic flair, social engagement, and creative experimentation. We value strong storytelling instincts and a commitment to quality in every edit and frame we produce.



Role 1: Long-Form Creative Video Editor

Type: Full-Time, Remote (US Hours)



Role Overview



We are looking for a Long-Form Creative Video Editor who excels at storytelling, pacing, and narrative structure — and who is seeking a long-term role within a growing digital brand. This is not a short-term freelance position; we are looking for a committed creative partner who wants to grow with us over time.

You will help shape extended content into engaging, cohesive stories that keep viewers watching from start to finish. This role is ideal for someone who values stability, creative collaboration, and long-term professional growth within an expanding media business.



Responsibilities:



Edit long-form videos including episodic content, narrative pieces, interviews, and extended skits.

Build clear story arcs with strong pacing, tension, and payoff.

Refine dialogue flow, timing, and emotional beats.

Apply sound design, music, and basic visual polish to elevate storytelling.

Maintain consistency in tone, rhythm, and visual identity.

Collaborate with the creative team to iterate on structure and storytelling.

Manage multiple long-form projects while meeting deadlines.

Organize footage and maintain clean project files.



Qualifications

Minimum 2 years of experience editing long-form video content.

Strong storytelling instincts and editorial judgment.

Experience working with narrative or dialogue-heavy content.

Strong attention to detail and pacing.

Ability to work full-time during US hours.

Comfortable receiving feedback and revising edits.



Role 2: Creative Short-Form & Social Media Video Editor

Type: Full-Time, Remote (US Hours)



Role Overview:

We are seeking a Creative Short-Form & Social Media Video Editor who understands what stops the scroll — and who is looking to build a long-term career with a fast-growing content brand.

This role is ideal for someone who wants more than gig-based editing work. We are looking for a committed, dependable editor who wants to grow alongside the business, refine our social voice, and evolve with the brand as we expand.



Responsibilities:

Edit short-form videos optimized for TikTok, Reels, and Shorts.

Cut scripted and improvised comedy skits for social posting.

Identify strong hooks, punchlines, and viral 
nts.

Add captions, sound effects, music, and visual accents.

Adapt edits to platform-specific formats and best practices.

Turn long-form content into multiple high-performing short clips.

Iterate quickly based on feedback and performance.

Maintain fast turnaround times without sacrificing quality.

description:

What You'll Do



UI Design — Create visually compelling and consistent user interfaces for web and mobile projects, ensuring a high standard of design quality across all deliverables.

UX Research & Wireframing — Conduct UX research and develop wireframes to map out user flows and experiences before moving into high-fidelity design.

Design Systems & Style Guides — Build and maintain design systems and style guides to ensure consistency across projects and streamline the design-to-development handoff.

Developer Handoff — Prepare and organize Figma files for seamless handoff to our Webflow developer, ensuring all components, specs, and assets are clearly documented.

Branding & Identity — Develop and refine brand identities for clients, including visual language, typography, and color systems.

Graphic Design — Support graphic design needs across projects as required.



What We're Looking For



At least 3 years of experience in UI/UX design

Proficient in Figma — from wireframing to high-fidelity design and developer handoff

Experience designing for both web and mobile

Strong understanding of design systems, component libraries, and style guides

Experience working in an agency setting or on multiple projects simultaneously is a plus

Self-driven, detail-oriented, and comfortable collaborating remotely with a small team

Hourly rate (negotiable based on experience)

title: PHP Developer - Remote Position
description:
You became a technologist because you love solving problems, keeping technology running smoothly, and making sure teams have the tools they need to succeed. You thrive on bringing order to complex systems, troubleshooting issues before they become problems, and ensuring both hardware and software are optimized for peak performance. You’re the person people rely on when things go wrong—and you love

making sure they don’t.



Position Overview

We’re seeking a skilled PHP Developer to join our remote team and support critical business automation projects, custom portal development, and AI-powered tools. This role is essential for advancing our digital transformation initiatives and supporting our distributed workforce.



Key Responsibilities

- Develop and maintain custom WordPress-based intranet portals and business applications

- Build and maintain API integrations with business systems (Salesforce, Google Workspace, QuickBooks, Clockify, Zapier, Expensify)

- Provide internal IT support and troubleshooting for remote employees

- Ensure website security, performance, and uptime

- Design and implement business process automation solutions

- Support AI development projects including chat functionality and automated evaluation tools

- Database management and optimization

- Support internal teams with tech solutions, including automations and integrations of existing tools and platforms

- Participate in daily team huddles and provide regular project updates (15-30 minutes)



Required Technical Skills

- PHP Development: 5+ years experience with modern PHP (7.4+)

- LAMP Stack: Linux, Apache/Nginx, MySQL, PHP

- WordPress: Custom plugin/theme development, REST API integration

- Database Management: MySQL optimization, complex queries, data modeling

- API Development: RESTful services, third-party integrations

- Version Control: Git workflows and collaborative development

- Frontend Integration: JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 for full-stack projects

- Web & Server Security: Deep knowledge of security protocols and troubleshooting technical issues

- Communication Skills: Ability to communicate clearly and confidently with US-based teams, particularly over phone and video calls

- Versatility: Comfort with diverse tasks, from managing support tickets to optimizing databases or troubleshooting server issues



Preferred Experience

- Business System Integration: QuickBooks API, accounting software connections

- Manufacturing/Industrial Software: ERP systems, project management tools

- Process Automation: Workflow automation, data import/export systems

- AI/ML Tools: Experience with AI APIs, chatbot development

- Cloud Platforms: AWS, Google Cloud, or similar hosting environments

- Security: Authentication systems, data protection protocols



Company Culture & Values (PERFORM)

- Performance Under Pressure: We excel under high-pressure situations 24/7, prioritizing respectful communication while delivering the right product at the right place at the right time.

- Eternal Perspective: With an eye to the long-term, we choose the right path over the quick fix, ensuring our actions can always stand up to scrutiny.

- Rigor: We stand out through our meticulous attention to detail, catching what others miss to provide peace of mind to all stakeholders.

- Foresight: We shrewdly share information with external entities, preserving our internal advantages while maintaining absolute honesty in our dealings.

- Ownership: We cultivate a culture of Extreme Ownership, encouraging transparency, honesty, humility, and vulnerability within our team.

- Responsiveness: Always organized and ahead of the curve, we’re prepared to respond swiftly and proactively to needs, always prioritizing communication and fast response times.

- Make Money Together: We uphold a belief in collective success, understanding that when one wins, we all win, and reflect this in our compensation structure.



Work Environment

- 100% Remote Position with flexible scheduling

- Ability to work 09:00-17:00 MDT UTC-6

-A quiet, dedicated home office setup

- Fast-paced environment supporting critical business functions

- Collaborative project work with operations and sales teams

- Daily team huddle participation 

- Single employment expectation (no competing commitments)



We value dedication and focus in our tea
mbers. As a condition of employment, we expect our employees to commit fully to their role with us and not engage in other employment or freelance work. This policy is in place to ensure that our employees are able to perform at their best and contribute fully to the success of our team. If you are currently holding another job or considering additional work, please be aware that we require a commitment to this position as your sole employment.



Compensation & Benefits

- Competitive salary based on experience

- Flexible time off

- Equipment and home office setup support



Ready to join our team? Apply now, it literally takes 6 minutes. No weird questions.

title: Influencer Outreach VA
description:
We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Influencer Outreach VA to join our team. This role focuses on sourcing influencers on TikTok and reaching out to them on Instagram. If you are organized, proactive, and comfortable sending a high volume of direct messages every day while actively engaging with influencer content, this position is for you.



Your main responsibility will be sourcing influencers on TikTok based on criteria we provide. You will identify qualified creators, review their profiles to ensure they match our target audience, and then locate their Instagram accounts. Once verified, you will add them to our lead tracking sheet and begin outreach on Instagram.



You will send 50 to 100 Instagram direct messages per day to influencers. In addition to messaging, you will actively engage with leads by liking their posts and stories, leaving thoughtful comments on their content, following their accounts, and interacting naturally to warm up conversations. You will follow a messaging script while keeping the tone conversational and authentic.



You will track all sourced leads, outreach activity, and responses inside Google Sheets. You will update lead statuses such as Sourced, Sent, Replied, Interested, Not Interested, and Follow-Up, and keep detailed notes on conversations and profile activity. You will send follow-up messages when required and submit a short daily report showing how many influencers were sourced on TikTok, how many Instagra
ssages were sent, how many profiles were engaged with, and how many replies were received.



We are looking for someone with strong written English skills who can communicate in a natural and friendly tone. You must be comfortable using both TikTok for research and Instagram for outreach on a daily basis. Experience with influencer sourcing, outreach, affiliate recruitment, or lead generation is preferred. You must be organized, proactive, able to follow instructions carefully, meet daily quotas, and have a reliable internet connection. Availability of 20 to 40 hours per week is required.



Compensation is $3 per hour for 20 to 40 hours per week depending on performance and availability. This is a long-term opportunity for the right candidate who is consistent, reliable, and results-driven.



To apply, please send a short introduction about yourself, describe your experience with TikTok sourcing or Instagram outreach if you have any, share your weekly availability in hours, include your internet speed, and write the word OUTREACH in your subject line.



We are looking to hire as soon as possible.

title: Inventory and Reconciliation Bookkeeper
description:
Join Our Remote Accounting Team

We are a fast-growing, boutique outsourced accounting firm supporting high-growth e-commerce and service-based businesses. Our team works behind the scenes to help dynamic DTC brands stay financially organized, inventory-accurate, and positioned for smart growth.



Many of our clients operate in product-based environments, including brands that assemble or manufacture their own products. While deep manufacturing expertise is not required, familiarity with assemblies and product costing is a strong plus.

We are a fully remote company with a collaborative, detail-oriented culture. We value accountability, clear communication, and continuous improvement.



We are looking for an Inventory & Reconciliation Bookkeeper with e-commerce experience who thrives in structured environments and takes pride in clean, accurate financial records.



About the Role

This role focuses on inventory tracking, reconciliations, and supporting month-end financial processes for e-commerce clients. You will work closely with senior accounting tea
mbers to ensure inventory records, cost tracking, and related reconciliations are accurate and complete.



Some clients maintain assembled or manufactured products, so exposure to Bills of Materials (BOMs), product assemblies, or kit structures is an added advantage.



This is an execution-focused role ideal for a strong bookkeeper with hands-on inventory exposure in an e-commerce environment.



Core Responsibilities

1. Inventory & Transaction Recording

- Record inventory-related transactions, including purchases, sales, returns, write-offs, and transfers

- Maintain accurate inventory records based on established procedures

- Ensure transactions align with vendor invoices, fulfillment reports, and sales platform data

- Flag discrepancies or unusual activity for review



2. Reconciliations

- Perform regular reconciliations between accounting records, inventory reports, and sales channels

- Identify and report variances in inventory quantities or costs

- Prepare supporting schedules for month-end review

- Assist in resolving discrepancies by gathering documentation and coordinating with relevant parties



3. Cost Tracking & Support

- Assist with tracking product costs, including freight and related expenses

- Maintain organized documentation for inventory purchases and adjustments

- Support preparation of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) schedules

- Prepare inventory-related journal entries for review



4. Manufacturing / Assembly Support

- Maintain and validate Bills of Materials (BOMs) in coordination with senior tea
mbers

- Support costing for assembled or manufactured products

- Reconcile component usage to finished goods output

- Assist in reviewing inventory flows for assemblies, kits, or bundled products



5. Month-End Support

- Maintain inventory roll-forward schedules

- Provide documentation for financial review and reporting

- Ensure inventory balances are supported and reconciled each month



Qualifications

- 3–5 years of bookkeeping experience

- Experience working with e-commerce businesses (Shopify, Amazon, or similar platforms)

- Experience with inventory tracking and reconciliations

- Experience with assemblies, kits, or manufactured inventory preferred

- Understanding of BOM structures and component costing preferred

- Strong understanding of basic accounting principles

- Proficient in Excel (LOOKUPs, Pivot Tables preferred)

- Highly detail-oriented and organized

- Comfortable working independently in a remote environment

- Strong written and verbal English communication skills



What We Offer

- Competitive Pay: $13/hour

- Full-time remote role

- Exciting benefits as an independent contractor

- Performance-based growth opportunities

- A collaborative, supportive team environment

title: Video Editor
description:
LEVRG AI is a fast-growing agency serving local businesses, ecommerce brands, and online coaches. We also run a personal brand in the sales and entrepreneurship space.

We produce 10–20+ short-form videos per week (Reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts) plus long-form YouTube content, paid ad creatives, and VSLs. Our content is bold, direct, high-energy, and built to convert into sales calls.

This role starts part-time but has a clear path to full-time as the company scales. You'll start editing our internal brand content, then expand into editing for our agency clients.



WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Editing high-retention short-form content (Reels, Shorts, TikTok) 10–20+ per week

Creating multiple hook variations per video for A/B testing (Get access to multiple hooks, body's and cta's and mix and match them.)

Editing long-form YouTube videos with strong pacing and retention

Editing paid ad creatives for Meta

Editing VSLs (Video Sales Letters)

Repurposing long-form content into multiple short clips

Adding captions, zooms, motion graphics, sound effects, and B-roll

Maintaining clean file organization and project structure

Eventually editing content for agency clients as we scale



PERFORMANCE STANDARDS

Short-form edits turned around within 24-48 hours

Long-form and ad creatives within 48–72 hours

Revisions same day

Responsive during agreed working hours no ghosting

Implement feedback fast and without ego

Have overlap with PST (Pacific Standard
 Angeles UTC-8 ) 



REQUIRED SKILLS

Proficient in Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or equivalent

Strong understanding of short-form retention editing and hook psychology

Sharp pacing instincts

Clean, on-brand caption design

Basic motion graphics and transitions

Consistent, organized file management



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED BUT A MAJOR PLUS)

Direct-response ad editing experience (Meta, YouTube, TikTok)

VSL editing experience

Experience editing for coaches, agencies, or info-product brands

Understanding of conversion psychology and hooks

Experience managing content for multiple client accounts



COMPENSATION

Monthly retainer OR per-video rate open to discussion based on experience

Performance-based bonuses tied to content results and client growth

Clear path to full-time as the agency scales

Earning potential grows directly with your output and results



THIS IS NOT FOR YOU IF...

You take 3–5 days to turn around a 60-second clip

You only do cinematic work and have no interest in performance content

You need constant supervision to execute

You take feedback personally

You don't care whether content actually performs



HOW TO APPLY

Send the following:

Portfolio link or folder with at least 3–5 examples of your work (must include at least 2–3 short-form, performance-style edits)

Complete a trial edit we will send you a raw clip to edit as a short-form Reel. 

Submit portfolio/why you are the best fit for the job

Applications without a portfolio not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Receptionist VA (Remote) | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Supplier Relations Specialist Needed — POD Apparel Brand (One-Time Project)
description:
Here's a thorough post you can use on both platforms:

Supplier Relations Specialist Needed — POD Apparel Brand (One-Time Project)



About Us

We're a growing e-commerce brand selling custom apparel to a highly engaged niche market. We operate a Print-on-Demand model and work with an overseas supplier to fulfill orders across 50-100+ active SKUs. Our customers are loyal and have high expectations — which means our supplier relationship needs to match that standard.



The Problem We Need Solved

We've hit a wall with our current supplier relationship and need an experienced specialist to come in, take ownership of the situation, and get it resolved. Here's what we're dealing with:



Wrong fabrics being used — Products are being produced with lower quality fabrics than what our brand requires. We have mockups and product specifications, but they haven't been properly communicated or enforced, and the supplier has been making material decisions without our approval.



No clear point of contact — Communication is scattered across multiple WhatsApp threads with no clear accountability. It's difficult to know who is responsible for what and nothing gets resolved in a timely manner.



Slow or no responses — Response times are unacceptably slow, and follow-ups often go unanswered. This creates a lag that directly impacts our customers and our ability to fix problems quickly.



Unresolved open issues — There are multiple outstanding problems that have been lingering without resolution. We need someone to audit everything, identify what's open, and drive each issue to a close.



What You'll Be Responsible For

Communication Audit — Review all existing supplier communication threads (primarily WhatsApp), organize the information, and create a clear log of every unresolved issue with status and priority.



Supplier Restructure — Establish a single point of contact on the supplier's side. Define clear roles and accountability so we always know who handles quality, who handles fulfillment, and who handles escalations.



Product Standards Documentation — Work with us to document our product quality standards for each SKU category — fabric weight, material type, construction requirements — and get written acknowledgment from the supplier that they understand and will comply.



Issue Resolution — Actively drive all open issues to resolution. This means following up consistently, escalating when necessary, and not letting things fall through the cracks.



SOP Creation — Before the project closes, deliver a simple, clear Standard Operating Procedure for how supplier communication and quality control should be handled going forward so this situation doesn't repeat itself.



Supplier Evaluation — If the current supplier is unable or unwilling to meet our standards after this engagement, we need your honest assessment and ideally a shortlist of alternative POD suppliers who can.



Who We're Looking For

Proven experience managing supplier relationships, preferably with Print-on-Demand or apparel manufacturers

Strong understanding of fabric quality, blank apparel standards, and print-on-demand fulfillment processes

Available during Asian business hours (China/Philippines timezone)

Mandarin fluency is a strong plus — not required if your English communication with the supplier is strong

Highly organized with the ability to take a messy situation and bring structure to it

Direct communicator who follows through — we need someone who pushes for answers, not someone who waits for them

Experience creating SOPs or process documentation is a plus



Project Scope & Timeline

This is a one-time fixed project estimated at 3-4 weeks. There is potential for an ongoing retainer role if the engagement goes well and the need continues.



To Apply

Please answer the following in your proposal:

Have you managed supplier relationships with overseas POD or apparel manufacturers before? Describe the situation and what you resolved.

Are you available during Asian business hours?

Do you speak Mandarin? If so, what is your proficiency level?

What would your first 5 days on this project look like?

What is your proposed fixed fee for this scope of work?

We are looking to move quickly. Detailed, specific proposals will be prioritized over generic ones.

title: Insurance Verification Specialist - Dental Practice
description:
- Verify dental insurance benefits for general and pediatric patients before appointments.

- Check patient eligibility, coverage, deductibles, co-pays, and frequency limitations.

- Confirm coverage for specific pediatric dental procedures (sealants, crowns, fluoride treatments, etc.).

- Verify Medicaid, CHIP, PPO, HMO, and commercial insurance plans.

- Handle Coordination of Benefits (COB) for patients with multiple insurance plans.

- Document and report verification details accurately in the Practice Management System (PMS) such as Dentrix, Eaglesoft, Open Dental, or similar.

- Communicate with insurance carriers to clarify coverage and resolve discrepancies.

- Notify the dental team of any pre-authorization requirements or potential coverage issues.

- Maintain patient privacy in compliance with HIPAA.

- Provide timely updates to the team regarding changes in insurance coverage or plan rules. 



Required Skills & Qualifications:



- Minimum 1–2 years experience in dental insurance verification, preferably in pediatric dentistry.

- Strong knowledge of dental procedures and CDT codes, especially pediatric treatments.

- Familiarity with insurance plans: PPO, HMO, Medicaid, CHIP, and commercial dental plans.

- Understanding of Coordination of Benefits, Birthday Rule, Age Limits, Missing Tooth Clause, Waiting Periods, and pre-authorization requirements.

- Experience with Practice Management Systems (Dentrix, Eaglesoft, Open Dental, or similar).

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

- High attention to detail and strong organizational skills.

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple verifications per day.

- Reliable high-speed internet and quiet, distraction-free workspace.

title: Legal Administrative Assistant (Real Estate/Evictions)
description:
Location: Remote (serving Philadelphia-based law practice)



Schedule: Part-time Monday – Friday. 15-20 hours per week. Flexible Schedule

Compensation: $7 per hour, paid weekly via Wise

Benefits: 10 days PTO annually + all standard holidays off

Hours: 15-20 Hours per week



About the Role



We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant (VA) to support our residential real estate legal practice in Philadelphia, with a primary focus on eviction preparation, filing, and related administrative tasks. This role requires strong organizational skills, excellent written communication, and the ability to manage legal and real estate documentation accurately.



The VA will work closely with attorneys and staff to streamline case management, prepare filings, and assist with general administrative support.



Key Responsibilities



Prepare and organize eviction-related documents (filings, exhibits, notices, etc.) for Philadelphia Municipal Court.



Draft and format standard correspondence, case summaries, and legal notices.



Maintain case files, update internal case tracking systems, and ensure deadlines are met.



Research property records, tenant information, and licensing/registration details as needed.



Assist with scheduling, follow-ups, and client/tenant communications under attorney supervision.



Generate reports such as unpaid charges, rent ledgers, and case summaries.



Perform general administrative and data entry tasks related to real estate and legal matters.



Qualifications



Prior VA, paralegal, or administrative experience (legal/real estate experience strongly preferred).



Familiarity with Philadelphia landlord-tenant processes a plus (training provided if needed).



Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.



Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.



Proficiency with Microsoft Office/Google Workspace; ability to learn legal software.



Reliable internet connection and ability to work during Eastern Time business hours.



Compensation & Benefits



Pay: $7 per hour paid weekly via Wise.



Schedule: 15-20 hours per week. Flexible Schedule EST



Time Off: 10 PTO days annually + all standard holidays.



How to Apply



Interested candidates should submit:



A brief cover letter explaining relevant experience.



An updated resume.



Availability for a short video interview.

title: Cold Caller / Phone Sales — US Homeowners
description:
We are a residential home maintenance company serving Greater Boston and New England. We sell annual maintenance subscription plans to homeowners — and we need a confident, reliable cold caller to help us grow.



What You'll Be Doing:

You will call US homeowners and sell a home maintenance subscription plan. Your goal on every call is to close them right there, or book a firm callback to close them. That's the whole job.



Your Daily Targets:

45–75 dials per day

6–14 real conversations per day

1–2 closes per day (card taken or sign-up link confirmed)



What We Provide:

Two complete call scripts with full objection handling 

A preloaded lead list in our calling system (no hunting for numbers)

A call tracker spreadsheet and full daily workflow

Daily check-ins and direct access to the owner via WhatsApp — text anytime



Schedule:

3 to 4 hours per day, Monday through Friday, within the 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM US Eastern Time window. You pick your hours within that window.



Pay & Trial

$5.37 USD per hour. This starts as a 1-month trial. Hit 4 or more closes in the first month and we sit back down and renegotiate a better deal. You earn your raise by earning it along with making commission.



Who We're Looking For:

Strong spoken English — warm, clear, and confident on the phone

Experience in cold calling, phone sales, or appointment setting

Reliable internet and a quiet place to work

Someone who follows the script, logs every call, and honors every callback they promise

Honest — clean data only.

title: Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer – AWS Cost Reduction & K8s Optimization
description:
Job Description:

About the Role

We're a blockchain/DeFi company running production infrastructure that's bleeding money unnecessarily. Our AWS bill is sitting at $4,500/month – and we know it shouldn't be anywhere near that. We need someone who can come in, audit the whole setup, and actually fix it. Not just give us a report that sits in a folder.



We've already been through a few candidates who talked a big game but couldn't execute. We're done with that. If you're the type who needs handholding or can't work independently, this isn't for you.





What You'll Actually Do

- Audit our entire AWS infrastructure and identify exactly where we're wasting money (we expect significant savings)

- Optimize our Kubernetes clusters – right-size nodes, fix resource requests/limits, implement autoscaling that actually works

- Implement cost controls: Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, spot instances where appropriate, and cleanup of orphaned resources

- Set up monitoring and alerts so costs don't creep back up without us knowing

- Document everything you do so the team can maintain it





Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

- 3+ years hands-on Kubernetes experience in production environments – EKS specifically preferred

- Deep AWS knowledge: EC2, EKS, RDS, S3, CloudWatch, Cost Explorer, Trusted Advisor

- Proven track record of actually reducing AWS costs (be ready to share numbers/percentages)

- Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash) for automation

- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform or CloudFormation (Terraform preferred)

- Self-starter who can take ownership and execute without constant oversight





!!!!CRITICAL: This Role Requires Surgical Precision

This is production infrastructure running live systems. Think of this like surgery – one wrong move can take everything down.

- NO cowboy moves. You don't delete, modify, or remove anything without a clear plan first.

- Every change must be planned out, documented, and confirmed with the CEO before execution.

- Extreme attention to detail. You double-check and triple-check before touching anything.

- If you're not 100% sure what something does, you ask first. You don't assume.

- Methodical execution only. We value careful and correct over fast and reckless.





Strong Plus

- Experience with blockchain/Web3 infrastructure

- Karpenter, Cluster Autoscaler, or KEDA experience

-  AWS certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer)

- Experience with FinOps tools (Kubecost, CloudHealth, 
)





What We Need In Your Application

Don't send a generic application. We will ignore it. Include:

- Specific examples of AWS cost optimization you've done – what was the setup, what did you change, what % did you save?

- Your Kubernetes experience – cluster sizes you've managed, scaling strategies you've implemented

- Your availability and timezone (we need someone who can overlap with US business hours for some calls)





Compensation & Structure

- $20-25/hour based on experience and proven results

- 20 hours/week to start – potential for more hours for the right person

- Fully remote

- Initial project: Comprehensive audit + implementation plan with clear cost reduction targets





If you're someone who can actually deliver results and not just talk about them – we want to hear from you. Show us what you've done.

 relationships with project founders or marketing heads

 handle
